I did some googling and saw good reviews for Data Rescue 4 and though it 's not cheap , it DOES let you scan for what 's missing before you purchase and you can preview too , which is a great marketing strategy beause if the missing files are n't there then no money loss nor do you need to ask for a refund . It seemed like they were pretty sure of their product to take this approach. < br />< br /> SO I installed the trial version on the bootable drive , scanned his MBP ( which took 4 hours ) and TA DA ! It was all there ! I was a bit confused when trying to purchase the product ; initially , it seemed that they were going to mail it to me rather than let me purchase the serial number to unlock the trial version I had , but I misunderstood . We paid , got the serial number and everything worked great and it 's even user friendly . I bought this product several years ago when I was working in South America , but then did n't use it until we started planning for a vacation to Ecuador and Peru . Although I did n't complete all of Spanish 1 and 2 before the trip , I was still able to make good use of the lessons on the trip , in the airport , restaurants , hotels , stores and more. < br />< br /> Each lesson begins with a short conversation in a real life situation in a restaurant or someplace you will encounter traveling . In each , either a few new words or a new structure is introduced . The short conversation is followed by an explanation from the tutor and then exercises where you use the words and structures introduced in the conversation , as well as practice a sprinkling of words and structures for prior lessons . So you learn something new in each lesson , and practice what you 've learned previously . It 's a great system for me and gave me the information to let me build my own sentences with words I already knew . Best of all , it gave me the confidence to speak in complete sentences on our trip .#### #### ####[([177], [176], 'POS')]

This game was written in a rather odd fashion even for the time it was released . It was written 100 % purely in assembly language . For those of you who do n't know about programming , assembly language means a literal representation of a CPU instruction . The way most applications are written is with a high level language that allows some logical structure such as &# 34 ; if this , do that , otherwise that. &# 34 ; With assembly , you have to write down the raw sequence of events exactly like how the machine would think . At the time of MS-DOS era , game makers used a combination of high level language to get AI logic , and used assembly language to write low level functions such as displaying graphics or playing sounds . It 's fairly rare for a entire game to be written in just one language or the other . Of course , none of that means anything at the time since if you had the bare MS-DOS OS and correct DOS version , this game functions flawlessly . However , if you are attempting to run this on a modern OS using a emulator like DosBox you 're going to find the game does n't function at all because of how the game was written . With that said , I was able to get the game running on DosBox v0.74 after doing some research on it . The game does work but you will need to do some things which ca n't exactly be explained in detail here . I could get some sound running and the game does run a tad bit faster than what I remembered . Also , the game has multiple disks and you have to swap them out . What I did was copied the floppy to a folder on my local machine , then mounted a new folder and moved the contents of disk 1 to that new folder . When the installer asked for disk two , I simply moved the contents of disk 2 folder to that mounted folder . Otherwise I 'm not sure how to switch disks . Overall very good for nostalgic folks . As other mentioned before this game acts as a GTA game where you can drive around a very large city . The city is with static data where it comes with a map and you can visit many parts . It 's not a randomly generated city but an actual city of LA . The overall game is similar to the original Terminator movie where a robot has to kill Sarah Connor . You can play as the good guy or bad guy in this game . Just do some research and have a little patience and you can get this game working again on DosBox .#### #### ####[([39], [7], 'POS'), ([39], [214, 215], 'POS'), ([39], [285], 'POS'), ([138, 139], [130], 'POS')]
This version of McAfee works as expected for various scans and protection and has extra clean tools to free up space in hard drive . The price is unbeatable too .#### #### ####[([16], [15], 'POS'), ([26], [28], 'POS')]

I bought two copies of this Windows 7 Home Premium OEM product and two copies of Parallels 7 for the Mac after confirming that our MacBooks run 64-bit. < br />< br /> Once I had Parallels 7 installed on the MacBook , all I had to do was stick this Windows 7 OEM DVD in the DVD drive and tell Parallels to look there . The whole process was a breeze and Windows 7 installed just fine with only one caveat : Microsoft provides the Windows 7 product key in such microscopic type ! It was very hard to distinguish the letter ' O ' from the letter ' Q ' and the number zero . The Windows install process got really far before it bombed for an incorrectly entered product key . It took a few tries of repeating the process from the beginning before Windows completed the install. < br />< br /> Additional Notes :< br /> o I later found that the Windows 7 Home Premium installation has an &# 34 ; anytime upgrade &# 34 ; icon that I presume when double-clicked would allow me to upgrade to the professional and ultimate editions if I so desired . AUDIENCE :< br /> If you are a long-time fan of Corel VideoStudio ( VS ) and are trying to decide whether you should upgrade your VS to this latest version of Ultimate X8.5 or not , this review is for you. < br />-< br /> BACKGROUND :< br /> I have used VS since its version 12 ( X2 ) . I loved it in many ways ( especially its special effects ) , and I kept buying every upgrade of its &# 34 ; Ultimate &# 34 ; versions which came with extra contents , templates , and special effect plugins . Concerning for my existing installed plugins that I have accumulated over the years in my PC , I communicated with Corel representatives via the chat popups on Corel website , and I was told that Ultimate X7 and Ultimate X8 could coexist on the PC . So , I purchased Corel VS Ultimate X8 on August 11 , 2015 , and installed it while leaving my existing installation of VS Ultimate X7 intact. < br />-< br /> PROBLEMS :< br /> The installation froze up ( crashed ) near the end , during its plugin installations . The content library ( the listing of shortcuts to your media files inside VS ) was messed up ... After I reset the library , things seemed to work normally , but when I applied some proDAD Vitascene FX filters and attempted to make some customized settings , VS complained about the &# 34 ; Vitascene license &# 34 ; and prevented me from using the effects . I contacted Corel Tech Support via email and received an automatic canned reply on August 15 , and the message reminded me that I could PAY to get a quicker response . On August 20 , I received an email saying ,< br />-< br />&# 34 ; This is a known issue for VideoStudio X8.5 - ProDAD Mercalli . Our Development team is working with ProDad at the moment to solve the issue . Once we have a fix , it will be added to a patch or update so that your software will be able to automatically detect it and install. &# 34 ;< br />-< br /> Today is August 28 , 2015 , and I have not heard anything from Corel. < br />-< br /> CONCLUSION :< br /> This version of Corel VideoStudio Ultimate X8.5 is not ready as a release yet ! Believe other similar negative reviews : both the installation and the VS program crash left and right . Corel technical support is extremely poor now ( although it was very good and responsive in the past ) . Do not let the discounts and their short due dates tempt you to purchase it as I did . Keep your VS Ultimate X7 for now .#### #### ####[([73], [72], 'NEG'), ([73], [219, 220], 'NEG'), ([73], [323], 'NEG'), ([73], [433], 'NEG'), ([73], [443], 'NEG'), ([188], [189], 'NEG'), ([188], [192], 'NEG'), ([204, 205], [219, 220], 'NEG'), ([204, 205], [323], 'NEG'), ([204, 205], [433], 'NEG'), ([204, 205], [443], 'NEG'), ([428], [72], 'NEG'), ([428], [192], 'NEG'), ([428], [323], 'NEG'), ([428], [433], 'NEG'), ([428], [443], 'NEG'), ([431, 432], [219, 220], 'NEG'), ([431, 432], [433], 'NEG'), ([431, 432], [443], 'NEG')]

Runs very smooth and fast on Intel i7-4790K 16Gig RAM , Samsung 850 Pro SSD setup . No real complaints here . I have yet to get a blue screen , no OS crashes . I do n't know how this got on our machine , a Windows Vista system upgraded to Windows 7 , but it bogged our machine down and made Microsoft Security Essentials think there was a trojan , Peals.F ! plock , on my system which it was unable to get rid of after several tries and restarts . I finally got suspicious of a program called Webroot which had mysteriously appeared at the same time , probably as a result of careless browsing . I finally disabled it after several tries ( it kept coming back ) and now my system seems to be OK , as in no more spurious messages from Microsoft Security Essentials . To disable webroot open a command prompt window and type msconfig . In the window that opens uncheck all instances of Webroot ( WRSA ) under the Startup tab AND the Services tab and then restart .#### #### ####[([82], [104], 'NEG')]

As the main cook in the household ( yes , some of us guys DO actually try to keep our wives out of the kitchen lol ) , I have used this program over many years through the different versions . I have over 200 hardcover / softcover cookbooks as well , and you can probably understand that it 's not easy searching for recipes through my physical cookbooks ( although thankfully there 's a website helping with that now ) . Cook'n makes searching for recipes quick & easy , whether you are searching by ingredient , cuisine or course . You can search through the recipes you already have in the cookbooks on the program ( which you can add to via purchases in the DVO store , or easily make your own ) , or you can search the web for recipes via the program itself . My favourite part of this method is that once you 've found what you are looking for you can capture the recipe into the program , it even captures the photo . I actually have a cookbook I 've made in Cook'n simply titled &# 34 ; Web Recipes &# 34 ; into which I capture recipes that I want to try later . If I like the recipe I move it to a chapter in &# 34 ; Web Recipes &# 34 ; and if I do n't like it I just delete it . Nice and simple. < br /> Cook'n has had some problems over the years and like any software problems and glitches raise their head at times . The wonderful thing I 've found though is when they do happen , the people at DVO really stand behind their product . Customer support is quick , courteous and they really show they not only care about their program , but their customers as well . Updates are continually done to improve each incarnation and the ability to save your recipe collection to your personal Cook'n cloud account is a real gem . If any of you have ever lost work / files when your system crashes you 'll know what I mean . At this stage you might be thinking I seem biased and I wholeheartedly agree :) . When I find a product that works , is great value and is supported by the company that makes it like Cook'n is , I will ALWAYS be biased lol . Great product , great people working for them , great company . Could n't recommend it fast enough to anyone who loves to cook . And if you live outside the USA take heart - I know it states here that it 's only available in the USA but if you live outside you can purchase direct from DVO !#### #### ####[([297], [89], 'POS'), ([297], [299], 'POS'), ([297], [87], 'POS'), ([297], [301], 'POS')]

Great data recovery product . Simple and easy to install and use . Every recovery is unique and specific so download the demo for this software first to see if your files are recoverable and also set your expectations accordingly . One thing to be aware of which I encountered is that the default setting for the recovered file size is 2GB , so Data Rescue PC splits big files larger than 2GB into to 2GB chunks / volumes . This is n't a limitation but a default setting that is in place to properly support recovery onto FAT32 Formatted hard drives . Something that was n't clear at first but came up when larger files were being parsed . The good thing is that this can be adjusted in the setting preferences , by setting the file size value to zero to have an unlimited file sizes recovered . The bad , is that this larger file recovery is only supported onto NTFS formatted hard drives . I suspect that if you need to recover larger data files to a FAT32 HDD you would need to first recovery them to a NTFS formatted HDD and then transfer those files to your final destination FAT32 HDD .#### #### ####[([2], [7], 'POS'), ([11], [7], 'POS'), ([9], [7], 'POS')]

Software is a little glitchy ( Had one random error on install but kept going and it installed fine ; had a &# 34 ; not connected to internet &# 34 ; error when registering product but tried again and worked fine ; and the program froze once when ending video in advanced mode , but it did save my video - I just had to restart the program ).< br />< br /> I first ran the program in &# 34 ; Easy Wizard Mode &# 34 ; - I did notice that the video and sound did not appear synchronized in the preview window and was alarmed ( seems that is a common complaint ) , however the video and sound are synchronized in the video that was produced . Do n't let that scare you - I think some people see that in the preview window and assume it will be the same in the final version but it is not . Other than that I had no problems and completed copying three videos with no problems. < br />< br /> Next I decided to try &# 34 ; Advanced Mode &# 34 ; - I liked the options here better , especially being able to change the aspect ratio to 16:9 . It looks better in the final product when being viewed on my widescreen computer monitor and I assume on a flat panel television . Also , it lets you select output to fit on a regular DVD . It also lets you adjust the volume with an equalizer ( I added bass - some of the videos sounded a little hollow but that is probably my lousy laptop speakers ).< br />< br /> I have not tried to copy anything to DVD yet , but all my videos play just fine with Windows Media Player and look great ( considering they were old VHS ) . The videos are saved as . mpg files . I am so excited to have copies of my favorite Muppets Sing Along VHS tapes - they are not available for purchase on DVD and my VHS tapes are about worn out and take up too much space . Next up is my 25 year old wedding video ! I will update if there are any problems later -- keeping my fingers crossed . ( I purchased this at Best Buy because I had a gift card , butotherwise would have purchased on Amazon ).< br />< br /> A little tip - some VHS tapes were labeled 30 minutes but went a little over . I had one that cut off before the ending when set for 30 minutes so now I have set the recording time for 35 minutes just in case . You can stop it whenever you want before the timer ends too .#### #### ####[([16], [20], 'POS'), ([16], [299], 'POS'), ([61], [62], 'POS'), ([113], [62], 'POS'), ([113], [299], 'POS'), ([228, 229], [62], 'POS'), ([228, 229], [115], 'POS'), ([228, 229], [299], 'POS'), ([326, 327], [299], 'POS')]

I bought this product ten days ago because I 'm dyslexic and I wanted to &# 34 ; write &# 34 ; faster and with greater accuracy . The same day I purchased a new laptop that runs on Windows 10 . I realized that because Windows 10 is rolling out slowly , Dragon NaturallySpeaking Home 13 software might not be compatible with the new OS . I checked the Nuance Communications website and it confirmed that Dragon 13 is Windows 10 compatible . The thing is , it is n't . After installing the program and performing a microphone check , I found that the software was not only completely unresponsive to voice commands , it also crashed at random intervals . I uninstalled and reinstalled the program , purchased a different headset and deactivated the Cortana application in an attempt to get Dragon to work . None of my attempts were successful. < br />< br /> I sent a message explaining the situation to Nuance 's tech support staff . After repeatedly explaining that I had already employed the above troubleshooting methods online and over the phone and proving that my microphone works , I was e-mailed a download link for what I assumed was an updated version of Dragon 13 . In actuality , it was just an exact copy of the program I had already purchased . The version of Dragon I was sent was also completely unresponsive and buggy . When I relayed this information and my frustration at being sent a copy of a program I had already proved did not work on my machine to Nuance 's tech support , they stopped responding to my inquiries. < br />< br /> Subsequently , I used Google to see if anyone else had encountered the same problem I was dealing with . I discovered that Nuance 's tech support forums were filled with complaints from other people who had run into the same issue and had also been blown off by the company 's tech support staff . It was then that I gave up trying to make Dragon 13 work and returned the software . As near as I can tell , the program worked optimally with older versions of Windows , but despite the lies on Nuance 's website , Dragon 13 is completely nonfunctional on Windows 10 , so buyer beware .#### #### ####[([54], [111], 'NEG'), ([54], [59, 60], 'NEG'), ([54], [118], 'NEG'), ([54], [242], 'NEG'), ([54], [244], 'NEG'), ([54], [393], 'NEG'), ([53, 54], [59, 60], 'NEG'), ([53, 54], [393], 'NEG'), ([106], [111], 'NEG'), ([106], [118], 'NEG'), ([106], [242], 'NEG'), ([106], [244], 'NEG'), ([235], [111], 'NEG'), ([235], [59, 60], 'NEG'), ([235], [118], 'NEG'), ([235], [242], 'NEG'), ([235], [244], 'NEG'), ([235], [393], 'NEG')]

I believe that Norton Security is one of the best software security packages on the market ! Initially , I agreed with other customers about being disappointed that Norton no longer provides the disc . But then I learned that they provide 2-powerful tools ( Free of charge to anyone that wants to use them ) NBRT ( Norton Bootable Recovery Tool ) and NPE ( Norton Power Eraser ) on their website . NBRT allows one to do the same things you used to need the DVD to do , but it 's even more powerful . NBRT is versatile . You can install it on a DVD , or make an ISO , or make a bootable jump drive . When you run it , it updates the file to use the latest signatures for the scan if your PC is connected to the I-net ( I do n't remember the DVD doingt that ) . If you create the bootable jump drive and install NPE on it , you have the option to run either . If you want to know just how engaged Symantec is with cyber security , read &# 34 ; Countdown to Zero Day &# 34 ; by Kim Zetter . They have people working for them all over the world , and it 's good that they do ! You have 2-options : you can whine , or you can research ! !#### #### ####[([191], [9], 'POS'), ([191], [96], 'POS'), ([191], [100], 'POS')]

I love a good puzzle , but when I need to find a missing piece , that is who knows where , to get a puzzle to work I find that more time consuming than it needs to be . If HER wanted to make a game that was longer , then give me a better story , more interesting characters and more places to explore . Do n't make me go back and forth in the limited 3 locations of the game looking for stuff . Plus trying to get information or help out of any of the characters . I got more out of the Hardy Boys , but even their information was questionable at best . Not to mention they were just too juvenile at times to talk to. < br />< br /> There was also a lot of tedious reading to do , not that I do n't enjoy reading something that is informative or where I actually learn something , but I was disappointed on how many facts of Greek Mythology were inaccurate , which made some of the puzzles impossible to finish without a walk-through or cheat sheet . And I really hate playing a game that requires a walk-through to figure things out . Not only that , the few walk-throughs and cheat sheets that were out on the net varied widely from one persons game play to another . Which made things even more confusing . By the time I weeded through them I was n't sure what puzzles I needed to do and which ones I did n't . Which brings me to another gripe about this game . Why so many puzzles that did n't have anything to do with the game or those that you did n't even need to do to finish the game ? I agree if you love puzzles , this game might be just the one for you . I 'll let you know if my money was well spent. < br />< br /> If HER does n't start to improve their games in the future I will have to start buying more games by Mystery Masters , if you want an interesting story and beautiful graphics that ca n't be beat , even it they are just an H.O.G . Something I question about HER 's latest games. < br />< br /> That being said , buy this game for it 's puzzles and not much more . Let me tell you why you should not buy this product -- you are limited to a certain number of installs of this software ( another review said it was 5 , but I believe I only got 2 ) . After the limit , you are at the mercy of having to call or email ABBYY to have them give you another code for activating the software . They have an online activation feature , BUT DO NOT HAVE AN ONLINE DEACTIVATION FEATURE . Meaning that if you install this software , like I did , on your work computer and personal laptop , if you then get a new computer at work or a new personal laptap you cannot re-install the software ( as you used your two installs ) without explaining yourself to ABBYY and getting a new code . This is ridiculous . While , for example , you also are limited to a certain number of installs with Adobe Acrobat Pro , there is a deactivation feature which allows you to seamlessly deactivate the software on one computer , and then reinstall on another . Trying to get a new code from ABBYY is easier said then done . They actually prompt you to call Moscow Russia at their headquarters for assistance ! !#### #### ####[([123], [145], 'NEG')]

Buyer Beware ! I was on the verge of purchasing the Lightroom 6 standalone product when I discovered the following : Adobe is in the process of moving its products to a subscription-only based business model . The subscription-based version of Lightroom , for which you will pay a monthly fee and never actually &# 34 ; own &# 34 ; the product , will be updated regularly with both fixes and new features . The standalone product ( which is this one ) will get only fixes . You will have to wait until the next major upgrade ( i.e. version 6 to version 7 , although it appears uncertain they will even continue a standalone version at all after this one ) to get &# 34 ; new &# 34 ; features . Already there are complaints from users that 2 months after the release of version 6 , Adobe has added new features to the subscription version ( like the haze filter ) that you cannot get on the standalone . So just be aware of what you are getting ( or not getting ) with the stand-alone version of this software . It 's a very good product - but I give it a single star rating for what I would consider a lousy business model for the amateur-semipro market .#### #### ####[([219], [217], 'NEG'), ([219], [1], 'NEG'), ([219], [72], 'NEG'), ([219], [129], 'NEG'), ([163, 164], [217], 'NEG'), ([163, 164], [72], 'NEG')]

The only complaint , and it is a minor one , is that I thought scanning recipes from my multiple cookbooks would be easier -- but the scanning is only easy if the formatting is in one column -- two columns or more recipes just do n't work -- and being a speedy typist it is easier to just type in the recipes . Once you figure out the short cuts built into the program -- you find even the typing is n't laborious . Best of all the technical support is some of the best I 've encountered . I 've never asked a question that I did n't get an immediate response for -- sometimes from multiple people . Also the forums and the newsletters really help to keep you informed and up to date . Microsoft 's new privacy policy for Windows 10 : We will access , disclose and preserve personal data , including your content ( such as the content of your emails , other private communications or files in private folders ) , when we have a good faith belief that doing so is necessary to protect our customers or enforce the terms governing the use of the services . It seems there is no choice in this matter , by nature of accepting their terms you are essentially agreeing that they have access to all your personal content , documents and files . This is my personal opinion , but somehow that does n't seem right . First let 's get the technical review out of the way . Regrettably , this security suite performs exceptionally well , and without slowing down your PC to anywhere near what products from competitors do ( Norton , BitDefender , in my personal experience ) . Why regrettably ? Well , unfortunately , I am one of those people that believe in integrity , honesty and forthrightness , with which the people at Threat Track seem to take issue . Ergo , their shameless promoting of a &# 34 ; lifetime &# 34 ; subscription , when it is NOT a lifetime subscription at all . Read the fine print , and understand that this &# 34 ; lifetime &# 34 ; refers only to the &# 34 ; lifetime &# 34 ; of the PC on which it was originally installed , so if you 're planning on replacing your PC , or upgrading it yourself in the next few years , do not spend money on a product that will be useless on your next piece of hardware . This is not my &# 34 ; interpretation &# 34 ; of the pitch , it is DIRECTLY from the people at Threat Track themselves . Jerk-offs . So that 's why I say regrettable , because I finally found a security suite that 's acceptable , and the company turns out to be run by A-Holes . Just my luck . Regrettably , this security suite performs exceptionally well , and without slowing down your PC to anywhere near what products from competitors do ( Norton , BitDefender , in my personal experience ) . Ergo , their shameless promoting of a &# 34 ; lifetime &# 34 ; subscription , when it is NOT a lifetime subscription at all . Read the fine print , and understand that this &# 34 ; lifetime &# 34 ; refers only to the &# 34 ; lifetime &# 34 ; of the PC on which it was originally installed , so if you 're planning on replacing your PC , or upgrading it yourself in the next few years , do not spend money on a product that will be useless on your next piece of hardware . Over the yrs , it has enjoyed top ratings with many recommendations from avid players and teachers . The negative reviews posted here are spot on . Customer service is almost non-existent . BB25 will give you bizarre opening leads and bizarre bidding ( which includes over-bidding without the required support or point count ) . Even its defensive play is not what it once was . For more advanced users , you 'll love hearing a Michaels 2-spade cue from your partner ( north ) when he / she has 4 HCP ! I have questioned the developers about 20 + distinct hands . Each one required a explanation for BB25 actions that were inexplicable . Ive received a few replies : One saying the developers dont have time for bridge lessons , and the other told me they were too busy to respond . The BB25 mess is perhaps due to a change in how long BB takes to &# 34 ; think &# 34 ; about a play , lead , or bid . It now takes very little time for all actions . No matter how you set your play / lead / bid options , bizarre things will happen with fair frequency . This perhaps wont make much difference to the beginner , but intermediate and advanced players might wonder why they paid for this software . In my view , a better more consistent bridge-playing experience can be obtained from Wbridge5 which is free and easy to use . Do you like to purchase a software product and have it crash constantly , and work extremely slow the few times it actually works ? This program is for you then ! I have an i7-4770K with Windows 7 Ultimate 64-bit , 16GB of RAM , an SSD system drive , conventional HDD for massive storage and a decent video card even by today 's standards ( eVGA GTX 460 ) . This machine is basically a beast that laughs at most anything thrown at it . But PowerDirector seems specially engineered to utilize resources in the most inefficient and disastrous ways possible . 90 +% of my raw footage is not even full HD just 720p from action cameras . PowerDirector struggles to churn through minutes of footage and predictably crashes multiple times during the simplest of editing tasks . I do not have issues with any other application on this machine and I run some pretty demanding scientific stuff : Oracle VM VirtualBox with Ubuntu and Windows 10 tech preview ( before it was released ) , PTC Creo Elements 3.0 , Folding @ Home , Blender 3D , COMSOL and ANSYS v11 ( both FEA programs ) , and generally all sorts of video transcoding applications like MakeMKV , and Handbrake . I can run FEA solutions for hours solving for well over 50,000 degrees of freedom , or render ( ray trace ) complex scenes in Blender without any hiccups so I know the issue is not with my computer . PowerDirector will crash half a dozen times before I can finish editing a 5-10 minute video clip . Simply stated : it is garbage . Pros : - Came in a pretty box . - Managed to produce a few projects by religiously saving every 5 seconds and eventually giving up on features that cause it to not render the project . - Actually comes with a decent set of codecs for a variety of video formats . - Can handle high speed footage and the resulting slow motion video is cool ( if you can manage to get to a finished product that is ) . Cons : - Crashing , freezing , hanging , being stuck in an infinite processing loop ( this is so often that one starts to believe it 's the main function of this program ) - Redraw : OMG !! ! How can a piece of software not even properly redraw its own window elements in the year 2015 ???? ? This is coding 101 people ! - Clumsy interface , often not intuitive . - Nagging you to spend more money by upgrading ( LOL sure let me get right on that ! ) - It will make you want to destroy your computer with a baseball bat#### #### ####[([48], [98], 'NEG'), ([48], [122], 'NEG'), ([48], [131], 'NEG'), ([48], [257], 'NEG'), ([48], [322], 'NEG'), ([37, 38], [122], 'NEG'), ([37, 38], [322], 'NEG'), ([59, 60], [58], 'NEG'), ([88], [98], 'NEG'), ([88], [122], 'NEG'), ([88], [257], 'NEG'), ([88], [430], 'NEG'), ([88], [434, 435], 'NEG'), ([121], [98], 'NEG'), ([121], [100], 'NEG'), ([121], [122], 'NEG'), ([121], [131], 'NEG'), ([121], [257], 'NEG'), ([121], [322], 'NEG'), ([121], [434, 435], 'NEG'), ([255], [98], 'NEG'), ([255], [100], 'NEG'), ([255], [122], 'NEG'), ([255], [131], 'NEG'), ([255], [257], 'NEG'), ([255], [430], 'NEG'), ([255], [434, 435], 'NEG'), ([431], [98], 'NEG'), ([431], [122], 'NEG'), ([431], [430], 'NEG'), ([431], [434, 435], 'NEG')]

There is honestly so much that I can say about anti-virus software . They have honestly became much more of a essential entity whenever you have to get a computer , Mac or Windows . But finding the right anti-virus scan can actually be more of a challenge . Unfortunately many people have chosen to go to brands like Norton or McAfee to do whatever they can do to definitely protect their computer . But out of a lot of brand names , there are better ones out of the box , like BitDefender . It has been more of a surprise trying to get rid of all those cookies and spyware from invading your laptop , without a lot of problems . It really does a much more thorough job at getting through your hard drive and looking through those nooks and crannies and getting into your hard drives , external and internal and getting rid of the harassing malware . It really does a much better job at keeping the pesky phishing scams out of the PC . I truly have enjoyed this software a lot , and definitely worth the effort . I then purchased Pinnacle 14 and was still somewhat satisfied for awhile until it stopped being reliable . I 'm not sure why it wo n't burn DVDs correctly now while other software does so with ease . So I decided to upgrade to Pinnacle 18 Ultimate . I ca n't tell you how much I hate this product . Nothing is simple . It is now taking me at least four times as long to edit a video than it did using Pinnacle 14 . The main reason is due to the arrangement of tools and need for &# 34 ; importing &# 34 ; and &# 34 ; exporting &# 34 ; and other unnecessary steps to accomplish anything . Nothing is user friendly or intuitive . I cannot believe the reviewers that say it is easy . The professional reviewers mention how difficult it has become . One mentioned that it took him a month of intense training before being able to use it effectively . The learning curve is frustrating . No ... infuriating ! I do n't have the hours it takes to learn what should be an intuitive task . My latest frustration ( among dozens ) has been trying to figure out how to make titles . Why did they make it so hard to do the simplest tasks ? I do n't have enough room here to mention all the problems I have encountered . The only plus side of this product is the higher quality videos it produces . For whatever reason , Pinnacle 14 using mpeg2 never looked decent . I am going to try and find a product similar to their earlier software . I do n't know when they made these major changes but I am hoping enough complaints come in that the software engineers will improve the ease of operation . I 'm thinking of trying out the Wondershare editor , Filmora , which is said to be much easier and intuitive for the majority of edit jobs .#### #### ####[([33], [31], 'NEG'), ([39], [38], 'NEG')]

While I used to use Security Essentials and Windows Defender on my systems , I 've been disappointed with the performance of these complementary solutions both in my first hand experience and in third party tests . I 've used Norton and McAfee enough over the years to never want to use them again ( have n't used either recently , so it 's more a long standing bias than a current comparison ) . Having seen ESET perform well in reviews / tests , I decided to give it a go . The software installs quickly , though the disc is just an active link to the current version online . It seems odd , but you really need to use a current AV version anyway . Worry not if you like me lack a CD / DVD / Blu Ray drive , as simply downloading the software works fine . The software packaging has a certificate with the actual activation code for the license . If you 're buying a version that supports multiple systems , your ID you create after the first system will allow subsequent activations. < br />< br /> Once you get ESET NOD32 up and running , it 's pretty straightforward . The app is visible in the taskbar , and it also makes appearances when you make the very frequent ( seems like 2-3 + times a day ) updates . It will also alert you to yet to be installed high risk security updates from Microsoft. < br /> In general , those are all expected by me , and otherwise you do n't know it 's there . The installation does n't consume too much ram , and it has yet to yield and false positives or let any malware by ( I 've used it for 5 months ) . This is not a comprehensive solution , so you 'll want to use a firewall and perhaps a malware scanner such as malware bytes ( I would n't say that 's necessary , but the Windows firewall or another is essential ) . Speaking of the Windows Firewall , it works well with this , as does the security control panel app , and Windows Defender . Windows Defender can remain installed and active with ESET NOD32 ( other AV apps probably should be removed before installing this ) . Speaking of installing this , it will not install on Windows Server 2012 R2. < br />< br /> Full disclosure , my employer gives me a free copy of the software , though I 've also purchased licenses for three more systems.will not install on Windows Server 2012 R2. < br />< br /> Full disclosure , my employer gives me a free copy of the software , though I 've also purchased licenses for three more systems .#### #### ####[([20], [17], 'POS'), ([20], [96], 'POS'), ([20], [150], 'POS'), ([20], [362], 'POS'), ([20], [428], 'POS'), ([357, 358], [96], 'POS'), ([357, 358], [362], 'POS'), ([369, 370], [17], 'POS'), ([369, 370], [150], 'POS'), ([369, 370], [362], 'POS'), ([375, 376], [17], 'POS'), ([375, 376], [150], 'POS'), ([375, 376], [362], 'POS')]

The picture for this product is when it was first released and sold in retail stores . I 've bought 3 of these from this seller and am very pleased with the results . These are genuine Microsoft , not copies or fakes . They arrive in a 2-disk cardboard sleeve with COA and Product Key on the back , with the Professional disk and the Business Contact Manager disk inside . The double sleeve is inside a slightly larger sealed , white cardboard mailer . Each time the product arrived in either a well packed box or padded envelope . I 've never had a problem activating or using these because they are the real deal , just an older version of Office. < br />< br /> I bought the first set because I bought a new laptop and my old set of disks bought when the product first came out would n't install without a new activation key and Microsoft ( M $) wanted more money ( about $ 99 five years ago ) . While M $ no longer supports 2003 , I already had an SP3 disk for updates for this product that I made a few years ago . http :// www.microsoft.com / en-us / download / details.aspx ? id = 8 ( Note : Read everything because M $ checks some boxes for stuff you may already have or do n't need , then move on to the download -- burn a copy if you can to a DVD or flash drive for future use if you need to reinstall it. )< br />< br /> FYI , Outlook 2003 and Comcast ( Xfinity ) do n't seem to play well together . It did until Comcast made a server change about 3 years ago , so if you run into a problem where it wo n't download emails , etc. , it 's not you -- it 's Comcast . Search for Outlook error 0x80040FC . Some people turned off the IPV6 and others used 76.96.26.11 in place of mail.comcast.net . http :// forums.xfinity.com / t5 / E-Mail-and-Xfinity-Connect-Help / Outlook-2003-Receiving-Mail-Problem-fixed / td-p / 1305763 < br />< br /> For the above , changing the mail.comcast.net to 76.96.26.11 worked for me for awhile then it started stalling . The problem still seems to be Comcast . So if this fix does n't work for you , google the error code abovefor more answers . It 's not you . It 's &# 34 ; them. &# 34 ;< br />< br /> Eventually , I bought a genuine copy of Office 2007 and 2010 because many businesses , public and private , are running either 2007 or 2010 although there are some still running 2003 . To remain marketable ( employable ) , I wanted to learn both the old and new systems in addition to using WordPerfect , Open Office , and Libre Office suites . Because my hard drives are large and dedicated to my work * , I have them all installed on my laptop and desktop with no problems . My advice on that issue is to install 2003 first even if you have to uninstall 2007 or later versions to do so , then install the later versions but do not install the later ones as an upgrade because you will lose the prior version . For example , I only have Access 2003 . If I had installed 2007 , which did n't include Access in the version I bought , as an upgrade , it would 've wiped out Access 2003 . (* Writing , art , and photography software tend to make games run slower . :-))< br />< br /> BTW , my husband uses 2013 on his private computer but his office just upgraded from 2007 to 2010 . It all depends upon what someone or a business ( large or small ) can afford . M $ Office 2003 is affordable if you want to start using M $ Office or if you want to upgrade from Office 2000 , which I had been using before I upgraded to Windows 7 . FYI , Windows 7 and Outlook 2000 did n't like each other much but the rest of 2000 did work with 7 . According to the late Gilda Radner character Rosanna Danna , &# 34 ; It 's always sumpthin '.&# 34 ;#### #### ####[([487, 488], [620], 'POS')]

Saved the day when I lost a full CF card of photos ! Still in shock that I recovered the pictures . There are , admittedly , a few steps to take , especially if you 're dealing with a failing drive . It 's also a good idea to have a spare blank external drive handy in case you need to create a clone . But overall , it 's pretty straight forward , and if you have a little patience , it 's amazing. < br />< br /> Full story . I had just spent a day shooting head shots and group photos on a brand new CF card . When I tried to upload , the system froze , and I had to force quit . Upon restart card was blank ; everything was lost . I purchased and downloaded Data Rescue 4 for Mac . The install was simple : they email you a serial number , and you download the app and paste in the serial number to activate . ( Just be sure to drag the app into your app folder when you install . Initially , I was able to run it without having done so , and then I could n't find the application after quitting and trying to restart . It was a little confusing during a time when I was already pretty stressed. )< br />< br /> The software was fairly easy to use . It identifies the drives attached to your computer , and you choose the one you want to recover . You 're asked if you want to do a quick scan , deep scan , deleted files scan or clone . I tried quick scan , and it said because my CF card was n't Mac formatted , I needed to do a deep scan . I tried that , and received a warning that the transfer was too slow , and that the media was probably failing , and was encouraged to stop the recovery process and clone the card in case it failed completely. < br />< br /> I had an old external drive that I was n't using , so I reformatted that in Disk Utility . The software asked me which drive to use as my target for the clone , and I selected the newly formatted drive . Due to the bad card , the process was running so slow that it took all night . In the morning , it was 99 percent done , but it did n't appear to be able to finish the clone , so I stopped it. < br />< br /> At this point I was pretty frustrated . I tried to scan CF card again , but the card was complete toast , as I had been warned might happen . So , out of desperation , I ran a Deep Scan on the clone drive that I had cancelled at 99 percent . Unfortunately , I used a 2TB drive as the clone for my 64GB CF card , and the scan of the clone was going to take hours . But Data Rescue lets you stop a scan and still review the files that have already been found . After a couple hundred GB were processed , I stopped the scan just to see if I 'd gotten lucky. < br />< br /> At first , I did n't fully understand file structure . But when I performed a search for . jpg extensions in the recovered files , I was shocked to find all of my jpg and raw files in a folder entitled &# 34 ; Images. &# 34 ; The software had successfully cloned the bad CF card , and then had reconstructed the files from the clone . Before , there had been no visible directories or file names , just a blank CF card . Data Rescue recovered them all . It was pretty amazing stuff. < br />< br /> I ca n't recommend Data Rescue highly enough . The money I spent on the software saved me hours of labor , and the embarrassment of telling a client that I 'd lost all the pictures . Definitely a life saver .#### #### ####[([240], [243], 'POS'), ([240], [325], 'POS'), ([240], [631], 'POS'), ([297, 298], [325], 'POS'), ([297, 298], [411], 'POS'), ([361, 362], [411], 'POS'), ([407], [325], 'POS'), ([407], [411], 'POS')]

This game could 've been much better in graphics and gameplay . The graphics are simple but sill demanding . I am running this game with AMD Radeon HD 6990M Crossfire and 32GM Corsair DDRAM3 . Its running smooth but becomes heavy as time passes . The gameplay is the same as old days releases . That 's why I think that this game is made for those fans who still want to play the original game without any really new addition to the formula . However , the AI is a bit crazy here . It keeps attacking and generating units even when hitting its supplies , food production and income generation facilities . Having said that , you always need to defend your castle until the Al spends all its resources in attacking you . I find this annoying and time consuming because you need to build your resources while defending your castle before being able to attack and finish your opponent . Additionally , this game does n’t really have a campaign and instead relies on skirmishes , which can provide you with a worthwhile gaming experience . However , the gameplay is quite repetitive which shows that Firefly Studios failed to innovate anything . The game also lacks of interesting units , underdeveloped castle-building options , and basic tutorials which holds the game back if compared with nowadays gaming engines . Overall , this game is unique in many other aspects and worth playing given its current market value . I look forward to see new releases of this franchise with real development from Firefly Studios .#### #### ####[([48], [56], 'POS'), ([48], [235], 'POS'), ([46], [53], 'POS'), ([46], [56], 'POS'), ([46], [235], 'POS'), ([51], [53], 'POS'), ([51], [56], 'POS'), ([51], [235], 'POS')]

This disk was part of a project to replace my wife 's dead drive and upgrade her 6 year old laptop from Vista to Windows 7 . The first part was to obtain a hard drive which was accomplished first . Doing a clean install is not all that hard but it is also not something I would want to tackle if I had no experience . I have not done a clean install since the days of DOS so I was not sure what to expect . The first time I started up the disk I had the boot order set to CD first then HDD . I was assuming that the disc would have everything needed to load it and then boot from the hard drive . I got the message that the booy manager could not be found . I then made a Windows 7 Repair disk and ran the Startup Repair task . This ran for a couple hours ( really ) and finally finished . Once you start the program will not let you cancel . After the startup repair completed I then tried the Windows 7 disc again and it came up fine . Selected Custom Install and the rest was smooth . There was no problem with the Key that was on the disc sleeve . That was fine . I was worried at first because I had read some of the reviews saying there were problems . Well if there were I did not notice any . This review addresses the questions I had as an Apple Mac user considering this product . The 5-star rating is not my evaluation of Windows 7 Home Premium as an operating system ( it 's not my first-choice OS or even my second ) but simply means that the System Builder DVD fulfilled its intended purpose of installing Windows 7 on a single computer in an easy , hassle-free way. < br />< br /> You can ignore the technobabble about OPK on the box and just do a straightforward installation in the emulation environment of your choice . Instead of Apple Boot Camp ( which requires rebooting the machine to switch between operating systems ) , I prefer Oracle VM VirtualBox , which lets Windows run within OS X , rather as products like Parallels Desktop and VMware Fusion do . Those commercial products arguably have more features and better integration with OS X , but virtualbox.org offers an elegant open-source solution that does everything I need. < br />< br /> As other reviewers have stressed , this System Builder version installs ... I 've been using Windows 7 now for a few years , finally upgrading from XP which had served me well for many years but was starting to show its age . It took some time to get used to the new start menu and task bar in 7 but once I did it 's fantastic . The UI is beautiful and glossy with a sleek looking transparency effect on window borders , a stark contrast to the drab flat , square stripped look that has become common in recent years . Stability is rock solid and performance is great . This boots to the desktop in less than 15 minutes from a mid-range SSD and it has been very stable on all three systems I have it on . I have only a few gripes , Wordpad and Paint have the hideous and cumbersome ribbon interface but with instructions I found online I was able to transplant the versions from Vista with traditional menus and they work perfectly . The calculator has also been redesigned and is almost unusable for my purposes as I frequently use it to convert between decimal , hex and binary but it was easy to replace it with calc.exe from XP which also works flawlessly . Windows 7 is an excellent operating system , in my opinion the pinnacle of Windows evolution from Microsoft . I shudder to think what I will do when it finally becomes obsolete .#### #### ####[([58], [60], 'POS'), ([58], [62], 'POS'), ([58], [216], 'POS'), ([97], [99], 'POS'), ([97], [168], 'POS'), ([97], [210], 'POS'), ([45, 46], [99], 'POS'), ([45, 46], [168], 'POS'), ([45, 46], [179], 'POS'), ([45, 46], [210], 'POS'), ([92], [142], 'POS'), ([92], [55], 'POS'), ([92], [65], 'POS'), ([92], [99], 'POS'), ([92], [144], 'POS'), ([92], [168], 'POS'), ([92], [210], 'POS'), ([137], [142], 'POS'), ([137], [55], 'POS'), ([137], [144], 'POS'), ([137], [168], 'POS'), ([137], [179], 'POS'), ([137], [210], 'POS'), ([145, 146], [142], 'POS'), ([145, 146], [144], 'POS'), ([145, 146], [179], 'POS'), ([145, 146], [210], 'POS'), ([42, 43], [168], 'POS')]

Typing Tournament by Ed Alive is definitely a good way to learn how to perfect your typing skills . To play this game it would be good if you already knew how to use a keyboard and had a feel for just typing , even if you are just typing one letter at a time . Being familiar with the keyboard would really help . With that I put the disk in and started it up . It was very easy to download . I did it on my MAC computer at work so that my students could take advantage of the software next year . ( My personal hope is that this will one day be a digital download because its awesome and i 'd like to use it on my chromebooks ) . So , it prompts you to put in your name and pick a picture icon for yourself . Once you do that you go through a tutorial explaining the keyboard , what to do , how to type , hand placements . There are a ton of lessons and drills . You go through a map successfully completing all of your tasks to move on . I happen to really like the drills . I was sitting there just playing and typing and I was typing 26 words per minute . Which for me is slow but just to sit there and practice it was a little tricky . So , I think the drills are really great for children just learning to type . You start with all of the keys on your left hand and you use the letters A,S,D,F . There are a ton of mixed words they make ( some words are not actually real words but a combination of letters ) and you have to type as much as you can in three minutes . At the end it tells you how many characters you typed ; how many mistakes you made and how many words you typed per minutes . I think this is definitely a great feature . As you move on through the game you start to use more letters and then learn the keys on your other hand as well in a similar manner . I think this is an absolutely amazing way to learn typing . It mimics a lot of what I learned in middle school on how to type with a typewriter . I would HIGHLY recommend this to others ... It says first grade and up but personally I would wait until about 7 or 8 when they have a better fundamental knowledge of using a keyboard and a computer . I received this product at a promotional price in exchange for my honest and true findings .#### #### ####[([164], [80], 'POS'), ([164], [347], 'POS')]

Still not up to par with Quicken 2005. < br /> In July 2015 , I made a serious attempt to migrate to Quicken 2015 as I really want to get off MacOS Snow Leopard , but had to give up and revert to Q2005. < br /> The killer for me is the lack of lot tracking in brokerage accounts. < br /> The program would fail to import from Q2005 with no helpful explanation to why . Eventually , only my transactions could be carried over . No stock quotes , which had to be downloaded anew . Some other information was lost. < br /> As I had to abandon my use of Q2015 , this is not an in-depth review . Maybe there are workarounds still to be found. < br /> Many other shortcomings could be worked around , but would slow me down , would not match the efficiency of Q2005. < br /> For example , only the subcategory is displayed in Category fields . This means that Meals for business travel cannot be distinguished from Meals for vacation travel . Sure makes it more cumbersome when doing expense reports. < br /> All register entries are now one-liners . You can display the fields you used in Quicken 2005 , but this results in a much wider window . Inconvenient , when you have many registers and your bank website open at the same time. < br /> No calendar , so no overview of scheduled transactions. < br /> Everything now lives in the sidebar . Might be OK for those with a small amount of accounts , reports etc. < br /> I used many of Q2005 's reports and graphics . Most are not there any longer . Seems like I can create them as custom reports , but it would result in a long , unstructured , user-antagonistic list in the sidebar. < br /> Needs more work to meet the needs of the power users , but should be great for the light user. < br /> Eagerly awaiting Q2016 ...#### #### ####[([65], [67], 'NEG')]

I installed this OS on a computer that came factory-shipped with Windows 8 . ( Gosh , hate Windows 8 !!)< br /> I had to jump through some major hoops to get it installed. . but once completed , everything activated perfectly !< br />< br />( If you 're installing over Windows 8 , follow these basic steps )< br /> Please download the drivers necessary for your computer before you install a new OS . You will need to download Windows 7 drivers onto a flash drive. < br />- Disable secure boot in your Bios . Google this for more information. < br />- Set boot preference to the CD drive < br />- Restart the computer and begin the Windows 7 setup. < br />- Choose custom install. < br />- Select the partition on your hard drive that you want to install W7 on . ( I chose my Windows 8 partition ).< br />- Once installation is completed , update all the drivers from your flash drive. < br />- Install , and you 're good to go !< br /> Enjoy your awesome OS ! After installation , I noticed that my computer would just run really slow , it 's brand new and has plenty of resources , I did n't purchase a low end machine , so it easily met the requirements for the OS , for whatever reason it runs very sluggish , like if I click on an app to open or even windows explorer it may take over a minute before it comes up on my screen , yet when I go into task manager most of my resources are idling , so I do n't understand what the issue is . I find it absolutely amazing and pathetic at the same time , that Microsoft after 30 years of making operating systems , ca n't make something that just works . How can machines that had thousands of times less resources run windows better in the 90 's than the current machines today ? Microsoft should be ashamed of themselves , if any other company did this they 'd be out of business . The only reason that they are able to sell operating systems is because a Mac has to much of a markup and most people out there are either unaware that Linux exists or do n't feel comfortable going through the install . I wrote an earlier set of comments on Windows 7 Home OEM Builders Edition , but later discovered several errors in my facts. < br /> This is my final , and hopefully accurate , assessment. < br />< br /> I gather there are four differences between the OEM version and retail , here they are :< br />< br /> 1 : You can only choose one version , 32-bit or 64-bit , but will not receive both discs , as in the retail version. < br /> 2 : You can only install on one system . The OS is &# 34 ; married &# 34 ; to the motherboard and cannot be transferred to another computer. < br /> 3 : You can NOT install later upgrades , such as the soon to be released Windows 8. < br /> 4 : You will be entitled to updates and KB bulletins , but not phone or e-mail support for problems. < br />< br /> I am not 100 % sure about the upgrade option , but the other facts are apparently correct. < br /> As for me , the OEM restrictions are acceptable . Many customers are reporting problem free installations . A good sign. < br />< br /> I hope this final update helps. < br />< br /> Update ( January 5th , 2014 ) : This is my second copy of Windows 7 Home ... Before getting started you need to select custom install and switch off all the default security holes and data mining services put there on purpose . When you get to the desktop you will probably notice how slow it is and how much it locks up . So the only thing to do next to make your computer more usable is to change more default settings deep in the system and uninstall as much of the resource consuming , data mining bloatware as you can after you install all your drivers and such . The start menu is back by default but it 's not the start menu you know and love . It 's more like a mini smart phone interface designed as a start menu . The problems are part of their marketing strategy . Every year they add &# 34 ; bullet features &# 34 ; to entice people to upgrade . These features add bugs , which they do n't fix - ever . Once they fail to fix a bug one year it has NO chance of getting fixed in a subsequent year . This is corporate bean counter culture at its worst . The cardinal rule of software development is to retain STABILITY before you try to add features - and test the features you add thoroughly before release . This company follows the cardinal rule of quarterly profits - generate immediate income - product be damned - public be damned - company 's long term brand be damned . I bought Finale 1.0 in 1989 and every upgrade until Finale 2011 . I worked for many years as a QA Engineer in Silicon Valley . My advice is to find a used version of Finale 2008 - it 's reasonably stable and its bugs can be worked around . Beyond that , you 'll have terrible problems with audio engines , graphic export , lyrics , document corruption ... on and on . I still prefer F2008 to any of the competitors , sadly . Finale could have been great if they had n't let the money counters destroy their integrity ... sadly ... sadly ... sadly .#### #### ####[([91], [30], 'NEG'), ([190, 191], [30], 'NEG'), ([190, 191], [69], 'NEG'), ([190, 191], [126], 'NEG'), ([190, 191], [184, 185], 'NEG'), ([187, 188], [30], 'NEG'), ([187, 188], [69], 'NEG'), ([187, 188], [126], 'NEG'), ([187, 188], [184, 185], 'NEG')]

A few days ago I decided to upgrade to Cook’n 11 from Version 10 . ( I have been using Cook’n since version 8 which I bought in 2011 ) . Something went wrong during the conversion and as a result I could not open Version 11 . I contacted the DVO support group and they have been very prompt in their replies and suggestions . I still had versions 9 and 10 on my computer at the time I installed Version 11 . My problems have all been worked out now and because I had previously exported my various cookbooks I was able to import them into Version 11 with a new install . I did n’t lose much at all just a few new recipes in my personal cookbook that can be put back in. < br />< br /> Last night I started playing with Version 11 and I am absolutely thrilled with it . I thought Version 10 was good but Version 11 totally blows it away . Using the new Snip-It Import Tool I have been able to get recipes I had saved in Evernote into Cook’n and using my scanner I was able to add back the printed copies I had of the few that I lost during the initial install . Tonight I pulled out some old recipes my Mom had clipped out of various newspapers . Some are dated 1986 and 1987 and the pages have somewhat yellowed with age . I scanned these into my computer and then used the Snip-It tool and was able to get the recipes into Cook’n with just minor cleanup where creases or age of the paper interfered slightly with the OCR software . It beats the heck out of typing all this stuff in. < br />< br /> There are three ways to use Snip-It ; using a scanner , clipping from a web page or using clipboard . I have used all three methods . I LOVE VERSION 11 . ( The Capture tool is also still in Version 11 ) This is in my opinion the best Cook Book software out there and besides being so convenient this new version is so MUCH FUN . I have used Google image search to find pictures for some of the recipes that I originally printed but that when scanned did n't bring in the picture. < br />< br /> Like I said earlier in this review , I have used 4 versions now and whenever I have had a problem the DVO support team has done their best to help me sort it out. < br />< br /> I am very happy with the support from the DVO team and with the new Version 11. < br />< br /> I rate the software and support 5 out of 5 STARS. < br />< br /> Nina Irwin#### #### ####[([242], [245], 'POS'), ([242], [354], 'POS'), ([242], [449], 'POS'), ([285, 286], [281], 'POS')]

I have been using Snow Leopard on an early 2008 Mac Pro Tower computer for several years now . It is the BEST , fastest , most dependable , most reliable computing thing I have EVER laid hands on. < br />< br /> MY HISTORY < br /> I bought my first Mac in 1993 . Have owned many different models , including an LCIII , G3 Desktop , an eMac , the very first iMac , an iMac G5 , a PowerBook G4 , this Mac Pro Tower , and I have used Windows computers in offices I have worked in . I have also helped friends with their Macs and other friends with their Windows computers . I have also tried later versions of Macintosh Operating Systems including Mountain Lion and Mavericks. < br />< br /> So given my history , I should know something of what I am talking about , and I can guarantee that Snow Leopard is the BEST. < br />< br /> I really liked Tiger a lot , but it does n't run on Intels . Leopard was apparently a bloated mess that ran very slow . Versions after Snow Leopard are missing very useful features ... But Snow Leopard is a Lean , Clean , Stream Lined , Fast , Powerful , Reliable Beauty with all the features I have ever wanted or needed. < br />< br /> The first two things I noticed MISSING with versions of the Macintosh Operating System after Snow Leopard :< br />< br /> 1 . You can no longer simply double click on a folder to see the contents in a new window . You have to Option Double Click or something . This is ridiculous . The ability to EASILY : Create folders , name and rename folders , and organize my stuff into folders by dragging files and folders into other folders ... is the NUMBER ONE REASON THAT I HAVE LOVED USING MACS SINCE 1993. < br />< br /> 2 . The Show All Bookmarks page is gone from Safari in later Mac OS Versions . I do NOT use TABs . I WILL NOT use Tabs . I REFUSE to use Tabs . Every time I open Safari in Snow Leopard , my Bookmarks page is right there waiting for me to choose something I refer to all the time . Most of my Bookmarks are organized into folders all named appropriately , and though I am behind in putting Bookmarks from the New Bookmarks list into the appropriate folders , I can still find what I am looking for very quickly . But with NO Bookmarks Page in subsequent versions of the Mac OS , it would be IMPOSSIBLE for me to use BOOKMARKS ANY MORE. < br />< br /> 3 . I have just read that in the latest version of the Mac OS , there are even MORE things missing that people used all the time , like :< br /> a . No Geotracking in iPhoto , because iPhoto is GONE , and some CHEAP replacement called simply Photo has taken its place. < br /> b . You cannot stop your computer from answering calls to your iPhone , and you cannot stop your phone from getting messages sent to your computer. < br />< br /> Resizing albums in iTunes was also removed last year . And as a side note , the new Music App for iPhones is completely useless in every way. < br />< br /> I know this is a short list . There 's a lot more things that others are complaining about , but THESE THINGS ARE IMPORTANT TO ME AND OTHERS . Like I said , I HAVE BEEN A LOYAL MACINTOSH USER SINCE 1993 BECAUSE OF THESE FEATURES . So APPLE PLEASE RESTORE THESE FEATURES TO THE LATEST OPERATING SYSTEM , OR RESTORE SUPPORT FOR SNOW LEOPARD !< br />< br /> Thank You ! ! A very disappointed Apple Fan.he appropriate folders , I can still find what I am looking for very quickly . But with NO Bookmarks Page in subsequent versions of the Mac OS , it would be IMPOSSIBLE for me to use BOOKMARKS ANY MORE . 3. I have just read that in the latest version of the Mac OS , there are even MORE things missing that people used all the time , like : a . Windows 10 loads up almost instantly , apps load up in milliseconds . Even win 8 was n't this fast , sometimes I wonder if my pc is overclocking. < br />< br /> Start menu :< br /> The start menu is new and improved . You can now search for apps alphabetically . The search bar returns , you can search for files and apps and even search the web ( which can be turned off by the way ) . The tiles are completely customizable meaning that you can put whatever app or program on it and take off the ones you do n't want . Those who complain about it are simply too intransigent and just want windows too stay the same. < br />< br /> Multiple Desktops :< br /> This is n't anything new to operating systems but I 'm certainly glad windows decided to make it easy and useful . All you have to do is hit the windows + tab key then you have the option to create a new virtual desktop. < br />< br /> I am barely scratching the surface with this review , all I 'm saying here is do n't fully believe the negative hype about windows 10 . Yea sure , windows 10 does have its flaws but I am not blind . I know a great operating system when I see one . Give it a chance and if you do n't like it you can go back to windows 7 . I 'm pretty sure a few years from now , the people that are hating windows 10 now will have windows 10 on their computers in the future .#### #### ####[([125], [128], 'POS'), ([28, 29], [10], 'POS'), ([28, 29], [27], 'POS')]

I have used BibleWorks for many years in my research and writing and was looking forward to this latest update . The BW people have not disappointed . As an Old Testament scholar , I often was jealous of my New Testament counterparts that used previous versions , since the tools for Hebrew and Old Testament textual criticism were lacking or missing from those . However , with this new version , much more is available for Old Testament scholars . These include :< br /> 1 . Images of Codex Leningradensis < br /> 2 . The now available Stuttgart Original Languages module as an add-on -- this includes the BHS apparatus and in an update will include the BHQ text critical apparatus < br /> 3 . fuzzy searches that enable one to find similar words / phrases -- I have found this often helps me discover parallel language in other parts of the OT < br /> 4 . The full text of the New English Translation of the Septuagint -- much better than the old Breton Septuagint < br /> 5 . Better integration of the Samaritan Pentateuch -- one can now view SP text alongside MT !< br /> 6 . The Leiden Old Testament Peshitta is now included. < br />< br /> In addition , BibleWorks 10 has other features that are quite useful :< br /> 1 . One can integrate e-published books into BW 10 for easy access to any reference works from other publishers < br /> 2 . An entire library of Holy Land photos -- a great resource that enables me to include these in presentations for my classes < br /> 3 . The ESV Concise Bible Atlas -- and one can purchase the entire ESV atlas as an additional module -- again , this is nice for classes , as I can easily access maps to include in my lectures < br /> 4 . While BW 10 maintains the classic 4-column layout , it is no possible to close columns . I often like to work with three columns , so this is a great feature. < br />< br /> Overall , I believe BibleWorks continues to be the best available Bible software for anyone working with ancient languages .#### #### ####[([226], [186], 'POS'), ([226], [230], 'POS')]

Compared to version 9 , this is a greatly improved product . While &# 34 ; 9 &# 34 ; was prone to crashing or freezing my computer , Sony Movie Studio Platinum Suite 12 is far better at handling higher resolution files without causing problems. < br />< br /> This software has plenty of features , and if you install Sound Forge , which is included , you will have the ability to manipulate and combine audio and video into some sophisticated final products. < br />< br /> While this software is probably more than enough for the average home videographer , you 'll face a steep learning curve before you are able to fully utilize all of the features . I found the documentation to be less than useful , and far from comprehensive . But between the poor Sony documentation , and online tutorials on YouTube , you should be able to muddle your way through the first few weeks of use . Once you have reached a basic level of competence , you 'll find that this is pretty decent software. < br />< br /> This software presents your video and audio clips as virtual &# 34 ; film &# 34 ; and &# 34 ; tape &# 34 ; clips on a visual timeline . You are provided with a number of video and audio tracks , allowing you to add and layer multiple levels of video , audio , photographs , titles , music , and sound effects. < br />< br /> Unless you are a professional - I am not - you are more likely to be limited by the quality of your video and audio , and your skill with &# 34 ; Movie Studio &# 34 ; than with the capabilities of the product . Be aware , however , that this product requires a powerful computer with a fair amount of memory and decent graphics card . It seems each version of Photosuite becomes less intuitive and less functional as on1 tries to emulate its more sophisticated competitors . I 've been a licensee since at least v5 or 6 and I 've watched the suite change from intuitive and remarkable to duplicative and unremarkable. < br />< br /> Version 8 still retains some of the characteristics of their once-unique software and is far more intuitive to use than the dumbed-down v9 series , but you 're really better off using the more professional versions 5 or 6 , which you can often find for free . The software becomes rather generic after v6. < br />< br /> Worse of all is that they charge $ 79 to upgrade from version 9 to v 9.5 . I have to disagree with a lot of the reviewers on this thread.My personal opinion is that this product is the best kept secret in the music software world . I originally bought this product as a way to work with MIDI drum parts . I figured it only cost $ 40 so if I could n't get it to work I was n't out too much money . Once I started using it , it was WAY BEYOND my expectations . I agree with some of the comments about it being difficult to use , install , understand , etc . but I have a background in recording and was able to get up and running in about 3 days ( so I could see for the average user this might be more frustrating ) . But , once I got set up I was on my way . This program is PACKED with features . It is essentially a studio in a box . I 'm not sure amazon will allow it , but here is a link to a song I recorded on MC 4 . ( https :// www.youtube.com / watch ? v = wwk-JVXiTLI ) All parts were tracked separately and drums were imported MIDI tracks from a live drummer . There are some limitations . The default drums sounds are n't great and you can only have 20 effects active at one time ; which go pretty quickly when you are using compression , EQ , delay , etc . which is why I am giving 4 stars . Otherwise , I would give this 5 stars . I have been using this product for 6 years . The only addition I made was adding in addictive drums to get better drum sounds . Otherwise , I have never upgraded this product as others suggest you have to do . For anyone that has some experience with mixing and recording , this program is a gold mine .#### #### ####[([298], [296], 'POS'), ([298], [153], 'POS'), ([298], [225, 226], 'POS')]

Ok , it 's a given that Win 10 is better than 8.1 . It 's a pretty good OS . It 's also going to be supported for another 10 years . It 's a real good bet that &# 34 ; earlier &# 34 ; Microsoft products will go end of life well before this does . It 's also a good bet that as newer hardware comes out , you * will * need Win 10 to support it . All of the machines I have upgraded to Win 10 from 7 and 8.1 have done fine . I had one video driver on one of the 6 machines that needed to be updated ( 10 minute fix ) . That 's pretty amazing for a Microsoft OS upgrade. < br />< br /> Right now , you have a couple of choices here on Amazon . You can grab this USB flash version of Win 10 and directly install it . No fuss , no problems it 's a pretty easy thing to install . It 's a great thing for a tablet or laptop that has no DVD drive . There are two other choices . You can buy either Win 8.1 or Win 7 OEM disks and do the free upgrade . In both cases make sure you get the &# 34 ; with SP1 &# 34 ; versions to reduce the hassles . You will need to do a * lot * of upgrades from Microsoft Update with either one . I 've done both , the Win 7 process * seems * easier. < br />< br /> So what does this one do for you ? It saves 1 or 2 days of poking at the computer every so often to tell it to do updates again . Could you do them faster than that ? Sure , but you would need to sit at the machine for hours . If you are on a slow internet connection , it could take longer . If you are on Google Fiber at 1 Gb / s , can I come live at your house ? All approaches get you a fully working Win 10 machine . Check the current prices ( they change quickly ) . Right now you can save some real money going the Win 7 or 8.1 route . That * assumes * you have a DVD drive . If you do n't then there 's a bit of an added hassle getting the DVD onto t bootable flash stick ( or buying a DVD drive ).< br />< br /> Since these reviews hang around for a while - This was written when Win 10 first came out . You have a year to go from Win 7 to Win 8.1 at this point . A year from now , doing afree upgrade from 7 or 8.1 probably is n't going to work .#### #### ####[([104, 105], [116], 'POS'), ([104, 105], [422], 'POS'), ([192, 193], [116], 'POS'), ([192, 193], [422], 'POS'), ([264, 265], [174], 'POS'), ([264, 265], [422], 'POS')]

First of all , you can download a FREE DEMO VERSION for free at the ProSoft web site. < br /> The Trial Version will scan your drive and show you all the files it finds , and evaluates the odds of successful recovery of each file . You will not be able to perform any actual recovery with the trial version . But it gives you a Windows Explorer-like interface where you can go through folders and examine filenames . So basically , you can find out if this tool will work for you and your drive . I would highly recommend doing this , before shelling out any $.< br />< br /> You can then purchase an activation code for the full version . I would suggest not doing this through Amazon , because you 'll have to wait for something to come in the mail . I bought mine through Herman Street.com and it was only $ 30 . I got the activation code within about 3 minutes in my email . If you 've already downloaded the Trial Version from ProSoft , you can just enter your activation code and it will enable all the recovery features , without downloading anything more . The PC that 's running Data Rescue PC does not need to be on a network to operate , the software itself verifies the activation code. < br />< br /> In my case , this tool worked perfectly . I had a drive with Windows 7 installed , and it decided not to boot one day . Could n't boot in Safe Mode , and the onboard Dell diagnostic tool reported a Hard Drive Error ( very vague ) . Windows Recovery hung at a blue screen with a mouse cursor , not doing anything . So that 's what led me to recovery tools . This one got very good reviews . I popped the drive out , hooked it up to another PC with a SATA cable , and installed Data Rescue PC3 on the other PC . It was very easy to recover all my files , although it took a very long time to do so ( I had hundreds of GB ) . It will vary of course depending on your processor speed / destination drive / number of files .#### #### ####[([281, 282], [283], 'POS'), ([281, 282], [352], 'POS')]

This product and particularly the tech support staff were like a dream after a nightmare supplied by Apple . After taking my MacBook Pro , which would not boot , to the Apple Store , I was told it had a display card problem and needed to be sent to CA for repair . I asked if my data was safe since I had not backed up in the four years I had the computer . ( I know , I know , but am I the only person who does n't back up ? ) I was told that it was probably ok since my hard drive had been checked and had no problems , this by someone from the inaptly named Genius Bar . Without a text or email or any communication , the processor was replaced , the operating system reloaded and the hard drive reformatted . When it was returned I was told that my data was gone . I called several data recovery operations and was told various things - impossible , maybe 50-50 but it will cost $ 300 to find out then more by the hour for the work . I call the Data Rescue people , and found out for free that recovery was possible . Then for $ 99 the recovery was done . But the most impressive part of the story was the patient , careful , helpful tech support I got . I called several times and spoke to several people and always got the most courteous and helpful support I have received in almost 30 years of working with a computer . Great product and great people !#### #### ####[([142], [43], 'POS'), ([142], [138], 'POS'), ([5, 6], [43], 'POS'), ([5, 6], [237], 'POS')]
