Ok , it 's a given that Win 10 is better than 8.1 . It 's a pretty good OS . It 's also going to be supported for another 10 years . It 's a real good bet that &# 34 ; earlier &# 34 ; Microsoft products will go end of life well before this does . It 's also a good bet that as newer hardware comes out , you * will * need Win 10 to support it . All of the machines I have upgraded to Win 10 from 7 and 8.1 have done fine . I had one video driver on one of the 6 machines that needed to be updated ( 10 minute fix ) . That 's pretty amazing for a Microsoft OS upgrade. < br />< br /> Right now , you have a couple of choices here on Amazon . You can grab this flash version of Win 10 and directly install it . No fuss , no problems it 's a pretty easy thing to install . There are two other choices . You can buy either Win 8.1 or Win 7 disks and do the free upgrade . In both cases make sure you get the &# 34 ; with SP1 &# 34 ; versions to reduce the hassles . You will need to do a * lot * of upgrades from Microsoft Update with either one . I 've done both , the Win 7 process * seems * easier. < br />< br /> So what does this one do for you ? It saves 1 or 2 days of poking at the computer every so often to tell it to do updates again . Could you do them faster than that ? Sure , but you would need to sit at the machine for hours . If you are on a slow internet connection , it could take longer . If you are on Google Fiber at 1 Gb / s , can I come live at your house ? All approaches get you a fully working Win 10 machine . Check the current prices ( they change quickly ) . Right now you can save some real money going the Win 7 or 8.1 route . That * assumes * you have a DVD drive and do n't need to hassle with converting a DVD to a flash stick for the install. < br />< br /> Since these reviews hang around for a while - This was written when Win 10 first came out . You have a year to go from Win 7 to Win 8.1 at this point . A year from now , doing a free upgrade from 7 or 8.1 probably is n't going to work .#### #### ####[([19], [18], 'POS'), ([104, 105], [116], 'POS')]

Nancy Drew : Labyrinth of Lies was the seventh game I played in the series ; my SO and I chose this game to purchase as a &# 34 ; new-ish &# 34 ; ND title , and it was the best entry in the series we 'd played . Our favorite parts were the immersive setting , developed through the graphics , music , and puzzles . The graphics were rich , exotic , and it was the clear the designers greatly enjoyed bringing ancient Greece to life . The music , rashly labeled &# 34 ; elevator music &# 34 ; in other reviews , was charming and had an authentic Greek &# 34 ; beat &# 34 ; to it . The puzzles , while sometimes tedious , were satisfying to solve and appropriately challenging . My SO 's favorite was the seed puzzle near the end : colorful , logical , and perilous . All in all , we were really bummed when we knew the game was coming to a close , but the ending was very satisfying !< br />< br /> We liked the story 's complexity and enjoyed each step of the way . It was never clear who the &# 34 ; villain / esse &# 34 ; might be , since they all acted shifty and suspect . The characters were memorable and revealed surprising details as the story progressed . They all carried a unique sense of character depth to them , at least by the end . Unlike the other titles we played , much of the character development was contained in personal notes found on their tablets ( a modern touch ) - it was very cool to hear their thoughts. < br />< br /> Overall , the game can be overwhelming -- there 's a LOT of content in here . Some of the puzzles were listed , or noticed , but not solvable until a certain event happened , making a certain HARDWARE TOOL accessible where we otherwise expected it to be . Grudge aside , there are a ton of mini-games ( 10 on the cell phone !) , and if anyone likes science ( Chemist , here ) , the game includes testing materials for authenticity using bonafide analytical techniques ( fluorescence , spectroscopy , and reactivity ).< br />< br /> If you 've read this far , read no more : buy . Enjoy . You wo n't go wrong with this purchase and I 'm sure you 'll enjoy the story .#### #### ####[([63], [108], 'POS'), ([63], [132], 'POS'), ([63], [429], 'POS'), ([69], [71], 'POS'), ([91], [108], 'POS'), ([91], [132], 'POS'), ([91], [429], 'POS'), ([61], [108], 'POS'), ([61], [429], 'POS')]

The first is a popup that asks if you want more information about the McAfee software . This kind of popup is annoying . Every single day , this popup occurs once . To get rid of this popup , you just click on the word , &# 34 ; no. &# 34 ; The second kind of popup is worse , because the only way to get rid of this popup is to turn off the computer . This popup takes the form of a dialogue box that asks , &# 34 ; When should we remind you about all this ?&# 34 ; This kind of popup is actually like a virus , because it takes the form of a stable dialogue box that blocks your ability to have access to any of the files on your desktop and blocks your ability to access any of the folders on your desktop . To get rid of this popup , and to gain access to your computer files , you are forced to reboot your computer . I have twin boys both at the bottom of the 3rd grade reading level . It was discovered that my one son had eye tracking problems . While attempting to decode words he would insert letters that were not there and would say words completely different from the word on the page but with the same meaning ( he was guessing based on context ) . I took him for vision therapy which definitely made improvements but he still needed more . My Dr. recommended the Ace Reading program which I purchased with the goal of improving both boys reading speeds this summer . My one son doubled his reading speed . His problem was focus . Even though I was prompting him to read faster , he would read the words at a leisurely pace with many long pauses . He would start off-topic discussion right in the middle of a sentence . The Acereader pushed him to read faster so his mind could n't wander to off-topic discussions . My son with the e-tracking problem has increased his speed by 20 WPM . He still has trouble skipping words or lines and reading accurately when reading a full page . It was eye-opening to watch him read with almost 100 % accuracy when only 1 word was flashed at a time in the middle of the screen . The eye movement drills and highlighted text are definitely improving his reading accuracy . He was extremely frustrated with the eye-span comprehension games because the default times were much too fast for him to read the words , decipher whether they were the same or different and press the correct key . Customer Support was very helpful with showing me how to slow down these drill using Menu mode and showed me several options in Reading mode that I can use to enter reading text that matches his needs . I 'm very hopeful that continued use of this program will have him meeting all his reading goals and struggling less in school . A nice options compared to the $ 20 / hour reading class I was considering sending him to this summer . The classes may not have addressed his problem areas .#### #### ####[([23, 24], [25], 'POS'), ([23, 24], [239], 'POS'), ([23, 24], [260], 'POS'), ([305, 306], [25], 'POS'), ([305, 306], [260], 'POS')]

Windows 8 was a difficult move for many people . The user interface is optimized for touch , so it feels awkward at times with a mouse , and the combination between metro ui and desktop mode does n't quite mesh as well as it should . I admit , I too was a bit frustrated with the removal of the start menu . But ultimately these things are tiny gripes , and it 's really not so bad once you get used to it . The people who despise Windows 8 are largely either unwilling to adapt or computer illiterate. < br />< br /> I got Windows 8 when it was fairly new , and my experience has always been fairly positive . It is every bit as sleak and fast as Windows 7 , and I actually did enjoy some of the Windows Store Apps for a while . ( The novelty quickly wore off , though , as the selection is nothing compared to the iOS app store or Google Play . ) Compatibility has rarely been an issue for anything designed for Vista and above. < br />< br /> I do n't have a lot of huge pros to compliment about Windows 8 , but I do n't have any major complaints either . I do n't know that I would say it 's worth upgrading from 7 to 8 , because there just is n't that much of a difference , but I think it is pretty ignorant to say that it is much worse than Windows 7 , as many people imply . The enhanced task manager and some improved menus relating to system configuration are reason enough for me to say that Windows 8 ( and 8.1 ) is at least a step forward , even if not a very big one. < br />< br /> I bought this for a new rig , knowing the Windows 10 free upgrade is coming up . Looking forward to trying that out , and hopeful that this next iteration will be a big step forward .#### #### ####[([11, 12], [21], 'POS'), ([61, 62], [141], 'POS'), ([61, 62], [277], 'POS')]

Still confusing and difficult to use as ever ! We have been using DeLorme Street Atlas for over 10 years since purchasing our motorhome . Has a definite learning curve . Entering point A and point B are not too bad , it is the little things , like changing settings , making it take the route you want , and the missing roads that make this program frustrating . We had tried Streets and Trips at one point , but had issues with that as well . We updated from 2012 to 2015 but do n't see much difference . Still have to use Google Maps to find some places then put a Stop location on the map where the road SHOULD be , but is n't , on Street Atlas. < br /> One annoyance that 2015 has is that it seems to randomly change the map to point in the direction of travel , which we both hate . We want it pointing North all the time . When we go into options , the box for rotating in the direction of travel is greyed out and it IS unchecked , so we do n't know why it does it . Clicking on the arrow in the compass circle on the right side of the screen seems to fix it for a while. < br /> We used to do drive-by home occupancy inspections , and would do up to 60 in a day . This program was the only way we could successfully create our route around town . We would enter them in as stops , with our home as start and finish , and then rearrange and compute route until it looked like a good round trip . Of course we ran into problems with newer communities , but would then just find the location in Google and and it in on the map. < br /> The main plus of this program is that when using it on a nice 17 &# 34 ; laptop ( with a matte screen !) we can see surrounding areas and if we want to look at alternate routes , it is easier than on a 5.5 &# 34 ; phone or 5 &# 34 ; Tom Tom , which we have both as well. < br /> Overall , we like it and use it alot , but it could be more accurate and easier to use .#### #### ####[([5], [1], 'POS'), ([5], [3], 'POS'), ([5], [408], 'POS'), ([67], [68], 'POS')]

I purchased this item through a different store but I believe my review still applies. < br />< br /> I am a long haul simmer . Most of my flights are between 8-14 hours and include a serious amount of planning . Let me just be clear ; If this is the last flight planner ever produced for flight simulator , I will be happy . It contains a shocking number of features . From ETOPS calculation to complex routing that can do everything from avoid a certain airspace ( like North Korea or Crimea ) . You can also completely change your automatically generated route by hand or make one from scratch . SID / STARS and associated transitions are included and can be reviewed and added to the flightplan . This is the most valuable addition because choosing a SID / STAR is much easier . Just to be clear , you will need occasional navdata updates called AIRAC from Navigraph . If you are n't interested in classical music it will be a bit of a slog to get through it. < br />< br /> Software-wise this program ran fine for me on a Mac with OS X 10.10 , but it looks like it 's just been patched over and over again just enough to keep it running since it was first written back in the mid-90 's . That said I have n't had any issues with it so far and it 's worked fine with my MIDI keyboard . The only complaint I have is I have a true MIDI keyboard with no sound engine at all so turning up the volume in the software and my keyboard is really quite unless I pound on the keys . I get the fact that software companies need monetize their wares and recoup their investment ; however , for revenue consumers this is wrong . The prosumers in you might wish to use WinZip 's . iso file instead and make your modifications before installing. < br />< br /> In v18 and v19 there were big changes that increased the size of the graphics to accommodate touch screens , while eliminating the file tree that resembles Windows Explorer . As a result , referencing multiple folders and paths within a Zip is much less efficient . For example , while it 's possible to include folders and the file paths in order to restore these files later , the Path feature must be activated before files are added to the Ziip ( via a filter . ) This is neither efficient or intuitive . When 19.5 was released I tested it on a virtual machine and found it included additional &# 34 ; file management &# 34 ; software that installs as startup utilities . It appears that it can be turned off through the Options menu , but checking through Autoruns mine were still active . I am a long – time user and fan of Nuance Dragon Naturally Speaking . Over many years I ’ve found that each version was a step forward , but still buggy in its own way . I ’ve also long viewed Nuance customer support as deplorable . Nuance employs a very effective end-user firewall . Even so , I largely forgave the flaws which were overshadowed by what , for me was a continuing meaningful boost in productivity. < br />< br /> MY WILLINGNESS TO FORGIVE IS OVER ! I am one of the over 7 million people who now use the Microsoft Office suite by way of the recurring subscription plan , i.e. Microsoft Office 365 . Nuance Dragon Naturally Speaking v12.5 Premium and ( I have it on good authority ) v13 Premium ARE NOT functionally compatible with Microsoft Office 365 . Nuance does not disclose this plainly and their only user ’s forum answer to a serious problem that forces users to rely on the ridiculously limited functionality of the last-resort Dragon Pad function suggests that DNS users stick with stand-alone versions of Microsoft Office . For multiple PC users like me , that imposes a huge , largely hidden additional expense. < br />< br /> In fairness , Microsoft is n’t quick to reveal that the Office 365 applications do not become 100 % resident on the host PCs . Instead , some sort of hybrid local / cloud / background is employed . It is this non-localized application residence that renders Nuance ’s Dragon Naturally Speaking largely incompatible with Microsoft Office 365 Nuance ’s Dragon Naturally Speaking or visa versa if you prefer. < br />< br /> Thus , the subscription model of the world ’s most popular office suite and the worlds most adopted voice recognition application want nothing to do with each other ! Neither company is particularly forthcoming about this glaring shortcoming . Each conveniently points a finger at the other , while neither bothers of offer a reasonably visible and / or accessible compatibility warning ― not one that a customer is likely to see prior to purchase anyway. < br />< br /> So … If you are a fan / user of Nuance ’s Dragon Naturally Speaking , know that Dragon WILL NOT FUNTION with Microsoft Office 365 applications in the way that Dragon users have become accustomed . Dragon dictation CANNOT be input directly into ( for example ) a Word document . The ONLY means of input is the multi-step process of ( 1 ) dictating first to the simple plain text Dragon dictation Pad , ( 2 ) selecting the desired text from the pad , ( 3 ) cutting or copying the selected text from the Pad and ( 4 ) pasting the text to your Word document . Even Google ’s free office suite does a better job than this ! It too requires use of the Dragon Pad , but the with the free Google app , the Dragon Pad is called up when dictating begins and moving the Dragon Pad text to the document is accomplished more easily with the Dragon Pad Transfer button / command. < br />< br /> I have the sense that this issue will catch up with and haunt Microsoft and / or Nuance ( Dragon ) , but a lot of money will have changed hands by then and a lot of users will feel frustrated at best , and duped at worst. < br />< br /> Making all this a bit worse is the fact that I viewed Dragon v12.5 Premium as the most pronounced advancement to the product ever . Perusing Amazon online reviews of Dragon 13 Premium suggests that a nearly 25 % of those bothering to review give Dragon 13 just ONE STAR ! Many of those reviewers appear to be experienced and until now , happy Dragon users. < br />< br /> I submit that if the reviews were based on the combined use of Nuance Dragon Naturally Speaking Premium 13 WITH Microsoft Office 365 , the number of zero to one star reviews would skyrocket . Together , these products are a giant leap backwards and virtually useless as a boost to voice recognition productivity .#### #### ####[([304, 305], [265], 'NEG'), ([304, 305], [529], 'NEG'), ([261, 262], [529], 'NEG')]

As an interior designer , this is a key tool of mine used on my client 's behalf as , after all , so many folks have trouble visualizing , so it 's ideal for this application of test-driving various space planning and / or design concepts on paper. < br />< br /> But as a pre-build tool , it ca n't be beat . And as a result of the [ voluminous !] hours I spent designing and planning my own residence ( including placing all key furnishings ) , we had zero change orders during my home 's construction . As an aside , I 'd spent so much time in my virtual home that when the walls finally went up and the sheetrock was installed ... it already felt eerily familiar (!).< br />< br /> The how-to tutorial 's are definitely worth viewing as things are not necessarily intuitive , especially if you 've never used a program of this sort before . Wanted to mention that I ran into a problem this time as it turned out my Dell desktop did n't have a dedicated graphics card , so the output of . jpgs ( for clients ) was n't what it needed to be -- had never realized this when buying the computer . So I did have to purchase and have a graphics card installed ( the one I got was specifically designed for my model of Dell for 3D programs ) -- resulting in an extra headache and expense I had n't planned on . But it all worked out and now I 'm super happy with the caliber of final graphics from the 3D mode. < br />< br /> Lastly , I have to compliment and congratulate the Chief Architect team of tech support . Because of discovering this graphics issue ( the &# 34 ; final review &# 34 ; feature would n't even load ) and another question about only wanting wallpaper on some but not all walls in a given room I was designing , I made several calls to them following my purchase . They were SO nice , prompt , and knowledgeable -- wish I could put them in a clone machine for so many other companies whose tech support feels like I 've either landed in the land of robots .... or alternately am stuck w / techno-nincompoops ! On the wallpaper issue which also included a second crown molding which mysteriously appeared and I could n't deactivate , I was able to route the file for plan itself via their support interface , and within less than a day received a detailed reply back showing me by screenshot exactly what to do where to achieve the desired results . Just PERFECT in my book . And really warm , lovely , articulate folks with a genuine spirit of helpfulness to boot , a Very positive experience for this end user. < br />< br /> FYI , my graphics card exercise cost $ 117 for the part ( incl. shpg. ) and I paid my local Staples $ 39 to install it . Happy all 's upgraded now and I also highly recommend the manufacturer catalogue downloads , especially if you 're in the building trades like I am -- although do be aware some of them have ginormous file sizes. < br />< br /> Overall , SO pleased and delighted with this software purchase and , after over a decade of using earlier versions plus these most recent tech support encounters , I 'm surely a loyal Chief Architect fan for life ! !#### #### ####[([230, 231], [243, 244], 'POS'), ([230, 231], [605], 'POS')]

AmitBarnwal lists many helpful pros and cons of Mathematica 10 . I would add to his list that for those working in Graph Theory and Combinatorics , it 's still a major disappointment . Mathematica owes its very existence to its ease of use , and that simplicity rests upon its documentation . Typically , there are lots of detailed examples illustrating a wide range of applications and pitfalls , and for most commands they do an outstanding job . An unfortunate and glaring exception is the command MinimumSpanningTree , which incorporates methods that have become exponentially important in the past decade . Their documentation for this command is so inadequate and the few , pathetic examples are so trivial that their perfunctory explanations are completely useless . They have now included this command in several versions of Mathematica , and I 've waited patiently for their documentation to improve , but it has n't . In fact , in this version they state simply that MinimumSpanningTree has been replaced by FindSpanningTree . This is appalling . Mathematica developers need to spend less time creating bloatware by adding hundreds of functions and combining them into more and more unwieldy packages , and instead spend more time improving their documentation to make their existing commands more useful . Mathematica seems to have been constructed by geeks who were born after 1990 and know absolutely nothing about good business practices .#### #### ####[([43], [41], 'NEG'), ([104], [110], 'NEG'), ([166], [110], 'NEG'), ([166], [175], 'NEG'), ([166], [215], 'NEG'), ([171], [175], 'NEG'), ([171], [215], 'NEG'), ([208], [32], 'NEG'), ([208], [215], 'NEG')]

A passable introduction to programming in Visual Basic . NET , with an author that ' s clearly skilled and pleasant to listen to , but with some major flaws . First of all , I understand the strategy of explaining even the basics of the language with a desktop style program instead of a boring console application , though I am not totally sold on it . I am not totally sure that learning the basics of the language in the midst of buttons and controls won ' t obscure and weaken the foundation of understanding that a good programmer need , but then again , maybe I am just old school. < br /> But if you choose to teach the fundamental of the language in a graphic framework , at least have the decency to do so in a modern one , like windows apps or at least WPF , not the jurassic windows forms. . Yes , I know , they are simple , but they are so obsolete now !< br /> Also , I would explain both the graphic framework and the language together as we go along , not make a long , boring overview of the window forms controls , that besides killing all the excitement in learning a programming language also make little sense if you do it before you know what a class or an even is. .< br /> Finally , I think the videos are too short . They range from 3 to 8 minutes , and I think the average student need more time to &# 34 ; get in the zone &# 34 ; , so I think they should be longer and some of them should be woven together . I find the constant switching from one short video to the next to be quite an annoyance and disruptive for and efficient learning process. < br /> This said , if you concentrate and pay attention and try your hand at the exercises that the author proposes ( I love this part ) you will end up with a reasonable understanding of the fundamentals of Visual Basic . The subject is explained clearly , and the choice of arguments is reasonable , though I think object oriented features should be emphasized more. < br /> At least the depth of this tutorial series is serious and not totally amateurish like the &# 34 ; Visual Basic Essential Training &# 34 ; series from Lynda.coml Basic Essential Training &# 34 ; series from Lynda.com#### #### ####[([184, 185], [248], 'NEU'), ([184, 185], [375], 'NEU')]

Then 75 updates later in the day at about the 5th power off and 30 updates at power off after the first night. < br />< br /> The new system found the drive , video card , and CD drive . After a computer operating system upgrade my Cook'n program was n't working correctly so I emailed the company and got a response within several hours that included an apology for my problem , clear instructions and a link for a new download along with a personal comment to let their representative know if I had any other problems . I have used computers for many years and have never enjoyed the level of customer service I have experienced with Cook'n . I have contacted them in the past with questions and have always received a personal response . I highly recommend Cook'n not only for the quality and capability of the program but also for the amazing customer support . I thought the suite included Microsoft Word , Power Point , Excel , and Entourage ( or comparable e-mail ) for MAC . I also thought I was also getting a CD . Instead , I was given a code for downloading the software , which did not work . I contacted Apple tech support on-line for assistance and was advised that because I purchased the software from a 3rd party vendor ( Amazon ) , Apple could not assist in the download . I was also told that the origin of the software was an out-of-country source with a code that was not compatible for in-country downloading . It was then that I was told that the software also did not include the e-mail component of the suite . Total loss. < br /> I had to purchase the Microsoft Office for Home & Business version of the software for an additional $ 219.99 to get the software which included the e-mail component . However , I had to purchase the software from Microsoft , not Apple to get the technical support needed for the download . Each time I attempted to access the Microsoft site , somehow Apple would re-direct my browser to the Apple Store ! Frustrating . I had to completely shut down my computer , wait for several minutes and re-boot before I was allowed to access the Microsoft site . Once it was downloaded , I discovered that I could not access my e-mail. < br /> A Microsoft technician attemptedto load my archived e-mail but the system crashed and in the meantime he had to leave for the day . The next morning Microsoft jettisoned me to their technical support office in the Philippines . A technician advised me to disregard the archived mail on my computer and re-open an account with the prior Internet carrier . She contacted the carrier , and they agreed . Again , we ran out of time . Next day I contacted the Philippine tech support office and was bluntly told by a technician to forget it , I would never be able to retrieve my mail . It was gone in cyber space forever . Then the phone connection went dead. < br /> I happened to glance down at my computer screen . My e-mail account was open . It was loading messages ... loading and loading ... message after message ! It was retrieving my lost mail ... all the way back to 2006 ! Holy Cow ! The first Philippine technician was right ... And the Microsoft Office for Home & Business e-mail software did work ! I contacted the old Internet Carrier and asked to keep the e-mail account open . &# 34 ; There is a $ 4.95 monthly charge ,&# 34 ; the rep replied . &# 34 ; Let 's do it !&# 34 ; , I responded . So it is . I am grateful for &# 34 ; Divine Intervention &# 34 ; ! All is forgiven ... but not forgotten . I am sharing my &# 34 ; lessons learned &# 34 ; not to harm but to enlighten those who may encounter a similar problem and perhaps , help avoid a similar experience. < br /> I am very pleased with most of my purchases from Amazon . They are have high quality merchandise , good delivery , and very reasonable prices . This is the first time I 've experienced a problem . I 'll be back !#### #### ####[([392], [393], 'NEG'), ([392], [699], 'NEG')]

So a few years later with my IFR , I realized that Microsoft FSX did not update the GPS database and research led me to believe that X-Plane had great ATC and GPS approaches. . at least that 's what their website advertised . Not so ... ATC communication is mostly background gibberish and certainly does not tie in to my real world frequencies ( NY Class B area ) . The GPS actually leaves out the approaches I am practicing. . approaches the 10 yr old FSx has . And then I read that updates require a subscription service no less. . that would also update good old FSX anyway , which flies more realistically at least with the stock C172 . Sure FSX is looking a bit outdated. . X plane has fantastically realistic clouds and terrestrial scenery while sparse , looks &# 34 ; real &# 34 ; , but for VFR practice , FSX scenery plants the landmarks you need. . and for IFR , well I ca n't be fighting the unrealistic controls all the time. . I need to practice &# 34 ; procedures &# 34 ; , right ... timing , radios , GPS inputs , etc . it 's almost impossible in X plane. . at least in the 2 C172 versions I 've struggled with . Add to that procedures not even existing ... damn these guys anger me . I hate that they get away with this . I hate to return the product because it hurts Amazon , the vendor and consumers in the end . Back to FSX for me along with a subscription service to update the GPS and hopefully charts .#### #### ####[([54, 55], [49, 50], 'NEG'), ([65, 66], [64], 'NEG'), ([65, 66], [157, 158], 'NEG')]

My daughter is a photographer , and right after editing some wedding photos her macbook pro crashed . Her next step would have been to back them up on an external drive and burn them to a disc , but due to the crash she could n't do that . We took the laptop to an apple store but were told it would be 14 working days before they could even look at her laptop . We then took it to a local repair shop and they said they could recover the data in 5 days . After paying $ 125 , we realized that none of the stuff she really needed , including the wedding photos were recovered . Through amazon , I purchased a new hard drive that my son installed to get her computer running again . Next , I purchased some hardware / cables to be able to connect the old , bare hard drive to my computer to see if it would mount , it did not . I then searched for recovery software online and found Stellar Phoenix . I decided to run a scan , mainly searching for photos , videos and audio . It took over 3 days , not good ! Once done , it showed folders named &# 34 ; jpg &# 34 ; , &# 34 ; tiff &# 34 ; &# 34 ; png &# 34 ; etc , which you can click on and get a small preview window to see the file , unless it was over 10 mb , which the wedding photos would have been . The next step was to &# 34 ; recover &# 34 ; the files . When I selected that option , it went to another window and asked for the registration key , which of course I did not have , so you were prompted to purchase the software for $ 99 . After wasting 3 days scanning , I was expected to complete the purchase without knowing if it even recovered the files we were after , not good ! So I googled recovery software for mac reviews and found that Data Rescue 4 was the highest rated option . I decided to try it and within 5 minutes , I was downloading the wedding photos ! There was an option to search for the files by name , which I used to find the folder she had all the wedding photos in . Can you imagine my daughter 's relief not having to tell her client that she lost all the wedding photos ? Thanks to Data Rescue 4 , mom was the hero of the day !#### #### ####[([30, 31], [126], 'POS'), ([127, 128], [126], 'POS')]

Honestly , the interface is a huge pain . The editing tools feel like a vector illustration program from 20 years ago , but with more constraints and complexity due to the way it handles materials . Simple editing operations ( e.g. scaling ) are n't uniformly supported across all classes of objects ( or not supported at all ) . Many common operations ca n't be triggered manually , and instead require a magic sequence of operations that have to occur in just the right way ( e.g. generating stair returns ) . It 's insanely difficult and often impossible to create your own objects and manipulate them as groups ( e.g. add a pergola to a landscape ) . And the interface does n't make anywhere near sufficient accommodations for anything custom ( e.g. I still ca n't model my roof eaves and slope to anything near what they are in reality ) . Accepting all that , I ca n't really find anything else in the product space , so I give it a grudging three stars .#### #### ####[([3], [6, 7], 'NEU'), ([3], [97], 'NEU'), ([42], [6, 7], 'NEU'), ([42], [124, 125], 'NEU')]

We have been working at my company with CorelDRAW since the first version . We have tried many other packages over the years . The main competitor these days is Adobe Illustrator . CorelDRAW has every feature of Adobe Illustrator and more . The pricing & distribution model is heads above Adobe 's model ( you get to own your own copy of the software + free software upgrades ) and the technology is better . I could go on a feature list that raves about the software but I will just pick one that is the deal maker for us over Adobe . The drawing canvas in Adobe Illustrator is limited to around 20 feet . My industry ( interior & exterior signs & advertising ) often creates products that are that size or larger and CorelDRAW allows us to not have to work everything under scale , we can work at 1 to 1 size . This may not sound like a big deal but working at scale when you will be outputting to machinery adds an extra layer of complexity where things can go wrong . Again , I can go on and on but CorelDRAW is a powerful , professional , and easy yet thoroughly expandable and customizable design package . I used Parallels daily for about 3 months , and had constant network related issues with my Parallels VMs . For no reason , packets would suddenly just stop getting to and going from my VM . Let 's get this out of the way , I skipped 7 and Vista , so I have the unique perspective of jumping from XP directly to 8.1 . What I Do n't like : App interface , I 'm saying this right now , I payed to get a PC , I want to see a PC-style desktop interface . App interfaces are for tablets , smartphone , laptops and other &# 34 ; portables &# 34 ; . Luckily 8.1 has exactly this , a way for us to have a desktop . Second dislike : Resource allocation : This goes back to the app style OS , when you open something , it continues to use resources . Considering I have 32GB of RAM , not really an issue for me , but others will be bottle-necked , so I 'm putting it out there . Third dislike : Update process . OS will start updates in sleep mode , and if it does and you come back to use your device , it will seem like it is frozen until the update finishes or you reboot ( which will cancel the changes and makes you start the update all over , but at least then you will know what is going on ) . What I do like : Desktop mode : easier to use , even better than XP , really like when you open File Explorer , it will give you the pathway tree and you can click anywhere along the line to jump instantly there ( big assist when migrating data ) . Second like : Customizable everything : Is there anything you CAN'T customize with this OS ? Place the taskbar anywhere , Make whatever picture your app icon ... and that 's not even the tip of the iceberg . Third like : Free Windows 10 Upgrade . I ca n't wait . All in all , the system 's not bad , but it 's truly built for what I am running ... a power machine . It will eat budget machines alive . I 'm hoping 10 will use less resources so I can stretch out more of the 32GB for other fun stuff ... .#### #### ####[([153], [96], 'NEU'), ([153], [150], 'NEU'), ([35, 36], [226], 'NEU'), ([35, 36], [329, 330], 'NEU'), ([98, 99], [96], 'NEU'), ([98, 99], [150], 'NEU'), ([152, 153], [96], 'NEU'), ([152, 153], [150], 'NEU')]

Lacks some of the shape tools and more sophisticated text handling you 'd expect from Photoshop , but has some very nice features that more than make up for these shortcomings - the best of which is that you have a tools console that let you fine tune most tools ( pencil , paint brush , airbrush , eraser , selection tools ) on the fly , as you go ( e.g. you can change the size , density , hardness , flow rate of an airbrush or brush or pencil - stop and change settings as you need then continue , no problem ) . Has a nice , rearrangable / customizable work area . Easy handling of multiple layers , great for compositing images . As someone who is very comfortable with Photoshop , I approached Adobe Lightroom with great reservation . But , I was intrigued by its editing tools and wanted one of its most useful features -- soft proofing . The learning curve was uncomfortable , primarily because Lightroom wants to be your primary photo manager . You must abandon your understanding of computer files and folders and give into Lightroom 's organizational style . Once that 's accomplished , everything else is easy . The photo editor is a joy to use , and the program allows you to jump out to other programs as much as you need to provided you use Lightroom as the home base . Initially , I found myself jumping to Photoshop all the time , but now that I 'm used to Lightroom 's tools , I find myself doing is less and less . Instead , I find myself employing the Topaz line of tools . It 's also easy on storage memory given the way edits are saved . And when all is said and done , and the image is ready to publish , the print manager is fabulous .#### #### ####[([36], [32], 'POS'), ([36], [196], 'POS'), ([84, 85], [88], 'POS'), ([33], [32], 'POS')]

First off , I 'll say that I am a fan of Lightroom and have been using it since Version 3 . It is my go-to program for importing / editing / storing photos both from my Canon DSLR and my family 's smartphones. < br />< br /> However , I was unhappy about how long Adobe took to fix glaring issues in their previous Lightroom 5 , and now Adobe 's new policies for Lightroom 6 are another thorn in my side . Specifically , the policy that standalone versions of Lightroom 6 will get no feature updates is just a poor way to treat new and long-time Lightroom customers. < br />< br /> Looking at updates to the * previous * Lightroom 5 , there were bug fixes of course , but Lightroom also gained the following functions :< br />- Lightroom 5.2 : added Feather control for the Clone / Heal brush , added Smoothness adjustment slider for Color Noise Reduction. < br />- Lightroom 5.4 : added support for Lightroom Sync. < br />- Lightroom 5.7 : added integrated Aperture / iPhoto importer. < br /> Nothing huge , but definitely some useful features. < br />< br /> Now with Lightroom 6 , features added to the CC ( subscription ) version are being specifically excluded from the standalone product . The first of these is the Dehaze slider , but I guess there will be others in the future . And once again my opinion of a good product is marred by the poorly thought out and greedy policies of Adobe . I 'm not sure what the correct policy is - but I do know that the current policy is the wrong one. < br />< br /> I 've read in a few places that Adobe claims the Sarbanes – Oxley Act of 2002 prevents them from adding new features to products already paid for . However , this flies in the face of real world examples from the small ( Angry Birds supplying many new levels for the initial 99 cent purchase ) to the quite large ( Microsoft giving all Windows 7 and Windows 8 users a free copy of Windows 10 ) . You need a better excuse , Adobe. < br />< br /> Edit - if you 've own a previous version of Lightroom * do not * buy the Full version here - buy the Upgrade version directly from Adobe and save $ 70 .#### #### ####[([149, 150], [103], 'NEU'), ([149, 150], [261], 'NEU'), ([234, 235], [103], 'NEU'), ([234, 235], [261], 'NEU'), ([319], [198], 'NEU'), ([185], [103], 'NEU')]

I feel it 's much easier to use than Word ( for me , anyway ) . But lately , Corel 's support has basically vanished . There is no support phone service , there is no support chat . The only thin you can do is email them and hope they get back to you in a day or so. < br />< br /> My problem started as I was preparing a paper that I needed for the next day . When I tried to open a new document , I got an error message that my &# 34 ; trial &# 34 ; version had expired and that I needed to activate the program . I had registered the program after I installed it and the program was activated . I tried re-activating it using the pop up box that contained the error ( it gave that option ) , but then I received a message that I had activated this program too many times on this computer ( it was the first install , BTW ) . Than , since I could n't activate that way , it said enter your Activation code . I never received an activation code , only a serial number for my legally purchased and registered program . As I needed to complete my paper for the next morning , I hunted furiously for a support contact number . I could not find any . Long story short , I never found any way to contact support other than sending an email . Fortunately , I was able to finish my paper on another computer. < br />< br /> I did not hear back from Corel until a day and a half later asking me what the problem was . I replied with an explanation of the issue . That was a week ago . I have not received a response to my reply containing the explanation . Normally WordPerfect does n't cause too many issues and when it works , I love the program . But you should be aware of this support status these days if you are considering buying this program .#### #### ####[([11], [62], 'NEU'), ([35], [33], 'NEU'), ([35], [42], 'NEU'), ([35], [379], 'NEU'), ([44], [42], 'NEU')]

First off , I did not buy this lamp on Amazon , but I did check here for reviews and found none . A seller on E-bay happened to be selling one cheaper because the box was damaged . Since I usually shop Amazon and especially read reviews before purchasing anything , I want to help other potential buyers make the right personal choice . So ... there is no good description anywhere about how this lamp works for a cubicle space . I took a chance and am glad I did . It has an adjustable bracket that cannot be seen in the picture ; it fits over the top of the cubicle wall . The problem is that the bracket did not open wide enough for my cubicle wall . This was a simple fix for me - I took the back side of the bracket off and then used strong double-sided Velcro to attach the remaining top piece of the bracket to the top wood strip of the cubicle wall . Hopefully , when I retire in 11 years , there will be no damage to the wood piece . :-) The lamp can be moved up and down on the u-shaped slide that can be seen in the photo . I do not believe that it moves easily enough so I keep it in a stationary position over my desk . It also swings left to right and in and out easily , but I have it positioned where I want it , so I do not use those features much either . Plus , it is only being held by hidden Velcro , so I do not want to move it around too much . I have a 60 watt LED bulb and it is bright and beautiful . When I first received the lamp and opened the box , I thought that I had made a mistake purchasing it because it is large . However , once I got it in place , it looks wonderful in my perfectly decorated cubicle . Best of all I will save my eyesight while reading at my desk . This lamp is exactly what I want and need it to be ... after a little improvising on my part . Where there 's a will , there 's a way !#### #### ####[([35], [37], 'POS'), ([35], [341], 'POS'), ([97], [37], 'POS'), ([97], [341], 'POS'), ([190, 191], [187], 'POS')]

The product works as described . The drives comes with both 32-bit and 64-bit Ubuntu , in bootable format . It also includes means for installation. < br />< br /> For a small fee , you get a usb 2.0 drive with a bootable Linux distro pre-installed . While you can make your own bootable drive , it 's a hassle in my experience , and I do n't like wasting usb 3.0 flash drives for such a task . This package gives you everything you need for less than the cost of a usb 2.0 flash drive , so you ca n't beat it. < br />< br /> The drive itself is mediocre quality and is n't name-brand -- I would n't use it to store any important data for instance . But that 's not what it 's for and again , the price is nice. < br />< br /> There 's a great deal of documentation online for bootable Ubuntu , so the support is strong. < br />< br /> I 'm a web software engineer . In terms of OS , I typically only use Unix and OS X . However , I recently purchased a cheap ASUS x55leb01 to run Windows and Linux . ( It was a more convenient option than setting up VMs on my development laptop , and it allows me to do some pen testing and exploring without worry as well . ) Despite the description saying it would come with Windows 7 , it came with Windows 8.1 . Anyway , I 've had some difficulty running Ubuntu 14.04 as a second OS . I partitioned the hard drive , configured the machine 's firmware and boot process and installed Ubuntu with this drive . Unfortunately , there 's apparently some issues with 14.04 and Windows 8.1 . The installation process is going to require some extra work . So this is n't a reflection on the product itself , it is just a note to make sure you look into compatibility and understand how to use this product. < br />< br /> Overall , I 'm happy with this product and recommend it for anyone seeking a quick solution for bootable Ubuntu .#### #### ####[([165], [61], 'POS'), ([165], [305], 'POS'), ([112], [61], 'POS'), ([112], [305], 'POS')]

After happily using Movie Edit Pro 17 Plus for a coupla years , I decided to &# 34 ; upgrade &# 34 ; to the 2015 version . I 'm two months in to struggling with this garbage - so I 've gone back to the older version . But hey , the $ 70 spent on this software was n't a complete waste ... the DVD works great as a shiny drink coaster . I use this software to edit together multi-camera live music videos . I mix the audio and edit together the multiple video angles into one video . My biggest issues are these ( in comparison to the three-year-old Movie Edit Pro 17 Plus ) : SLOW ! Something as simple as loading a video file into the editing window takes forever . Then , after finally loading your videos on the timeline , heaven forbid you actually want to visualize the audio portion of one of the files because rendering takes EASILY three times longer in the new version compared to the old . And while it 's taking forever , the software locks you out until it 's completed its task . UNSTABLE ! The program locks up at least once out of every 5 times I use it . I 'm sure the manufacturer can back me on this because they 've received DOZENS of crash reports from my computer . I can count on one hand the number of times the older version crashed on me over two-plus years . UGLY ! One of the selling points is the cleaner looking colors . This new version looks hideous and is harder to navigate because their choice in colors . I have yet to find a &# 34 ; Use old visualization style &# 34 ; setting or someplace to customize the visual settings so I can manually undo their &# 34 ; improvements &# 34 ; . AUDIO EDITING ! They 've changed the way the audio controls affect the finished sound . After years of getting great sound from version 17 , the exact same controls , used in the same manner offer much worse results . AUDIO SYNC ! In this version , you have the option of synching up multiple files based on the audio tracks . This would be great if it actually worked . It does n't . There is one feature I like in this version . The multicam editing works well in theory . Loading four different videos and clicking on which angle you want to use at which point in the video is a time saver ... but it wo n't use cropped video . So , instead of clicking and finishing , I then have to go back and crop individual camera angles before finishing . After running the old version and this version on the same computer , using the same video / audio files , I have given up on the new version completely and I will not be purchasing another version of this software . And just to illustrate my point - I started rendering the audio visualization on a 16-minute long video before I started typing this . The file is currently at about 50 % in calculating graphics data ... but at least my beautiful coffee table will be protected from cold drink water rings . Edit : I almost forgot ... ANNOYING ! Right out of the box , the program is unuseable until you register . And if you happen to have an earlier version registered from years ago and you do n't know your password , you ca n't use this version until you sort it out . No , &# 34 ; remind me later &# 34 ; . No , &# 34 ; deny registration &# 34 ; . It 's either &# 34 ; give us your information or get lost &# 34 ; . My solution was creating a new Gmail account and registering a password consisting of several choice explitives strung together . Satisfying but still annoying .#### #### ####[([269], [278], 'NEG'), ([269], [363], 'NEG'), ([269], [585], 'NEG'), ([334, 335], [363], 'NEG'), ([412, 413], [363], 'NEG'), ([412, 413], [415], 'NEG'), ([412, 413], [585], 'NEG'), ([583], [278], 'NEG'), ([583], [363], 'NEG'), ([583], [585], 'NEG')]

Fluenz is the best Spanish program we have used . We are homeschoolers , and over the years I tried several different programs with our children , including Rosetta stone , Berlitz , and Learnables . All of them fell short of our expectations . Fluenz is absolutely amazing compared to those other programs. < br />< br />( Rosetta Stone was very confusing to my daughter , because they never explained anything , and expected her to learn through &# 34 ; immersion. &# 34 ; I did the Rosetta Stone program myself up to level / year 4 , and I think I only gained about 1-2 years of high school level Spanish )< br />< br /> The Fluenz program is highly superior to all the other programs . It provides a teacher who speaks in English , and who teaches the lesson and explains anything that is confusing . The practices are very thorough , and my daughter 's accent is extremely good . Many people have commented that she sounds like a native speaker. < br />< br /> You can repeat or skip any sections that you want to . You learn through pictures and video , conversations , and also through extensive writing / grammar exercises . The entire program can be done on the computer. < br />< br /> As a mom who homeschools 5 children , and who has only a basic knowledge of Spanish , I really appreciated the fact that my daughter could do her entire Spanish program on her own . That freed up my time to help her with some of her other classwork . With Fluenz , I know my children could learn any language , regardless of my own person knowledge. < br />< br /> The only negative to this program is that there is a lot of repetition . So if you have a child who highly dislikes repetition , they may not like it . But honestly , without the repetition , you probably will not retain much of what you learned. < br />< br /> Soon , when my daughter is done with this program , she is going to test out of college Spanish through the CLEP program . You can get up to 14 college credits that way. < br />< br /> I tend to be very picky about curriculum , but I have to say that I cannot be more pleased with Fluenz.have to say that I cannot be more pleased with Fluenz .#### #### ####[([4, 5], [3], 'POS'), ([4, 5], [125], 'POS'), ([4, 5], [157], 'POS'), ([4, 5], [166], 'POS'), ([163], [157], 'POS'), ([163], [166], 'POS')]

Sound Forge Audio Studio 10 was included in the Sony Vegas Movie Studio HD Platimum 10 Suite I purchased in 2010 . I use Sound Forge every week to edit the sermons from our church . MUCH easier to use than Goldwave or Audacity , it is very easy to use . The only issues I have with it is I ca n't use 3rd party addons / codecs and I have to save recordings as wave files , then convert to mp3 with other applications like Goldwave . This is because for some unknown reason ( Sony has yet to address ?) , if I save it to mp3 , the length of the recording increases by a random fraction of a second . CD authoring software likes whole numbers , or more precisely , the players like whole numbers , otherwise they have to compensate for the fraction of a second causing the playback to not be consistent . This is mostly a problem when the fraction of a second occurs between 2 songs . It can affect gap length when you have 2 songs , especially without a gap between them ( think Boston 's &# 34 ; 3rd Stage &# 34 ; album , or Queen 's &# 34 ; We will Rock You / We are The Champions &# 34 ; song ) , there may be a stutter from the player calculating the length of the song . I have CD authoring software that will tell me a song is &# 34 ; not compliant &# 34 ; to the Redbook Standard ( https :// en.wikipedia.org / wiki / Compact _ Disc _ Digital _ Audio ) if I do n't edit my recording to whole numbers ( like 1:35 [ good ] instead of 1:35.035 [ bad ]) . Maybe a newer version of Sound Forge has fixed this error , but I do not know . Sony has yet to tell me if they fixed the error . I submitted it to them a long time ago and they said they would look into it .#### #### ####[([0, 1], [165], 'POS')]

If you also use Norton ( ID safe or other Symantec products ) , this software uninstalls the temp files , updates , and backed up files . This software occasionally changes the properties of files - such as the print spooler -- by uninstalling or relegating it to a status where it does n't start . You will have to manually go in and change that status back to proper start group . It also removes critical extension files of your downloaded software by deeming them irrelevant or space-wasting files . The software does help bring your system connectivity back to optimal speed with efficiency . One of the last first-person dungeon crawls from the heyday of such games . As such , it is pretty well polished and refined . In a sense , it is a rather &# 34 ; dumbed down &# 34 ; game , considering how complex most of these games were at the time . There are no experience levels , though the game 's systems kind of imitate a levelling system . In this game , your stat increases come from items you find while exploring . So , rather than farm levels , you will just have to search everywhere to ensure you are getting powered up . Your weapon and magic skills increase slowly with use , and monsters do n't respawn . Also , there actually is a useful , markable map in-game , so that is very helpful . You collect a decent amount of magic over the course of the game , but every time you play it is the same. < br />< br /> The pixel art and MIDI tracks are perfect , and have held up very well . The dungeons have a little more variety than many of the other dungeon crawlers of the day , and the layouts are a lot less frustrating with fewer nonsense puzzles and more pure exploration. < br />< br /> You are restricted to the one character , so if you are looking for a party based dungeon crawler , look elsewhere . Otherwise , if you are looking for a real classic and one of the best of the genre , you would do well to give it a try . Mount your disc drive in DOSBox , and it runs perfect on modern consoles . The only real downside I can think of is that it is n't very replayable , since you will want to explore everywhere and collect everything with each play-through , and it will be the same every time , with every character ( you pick one of five ) learning the same spells and using the same weapons. < br />< br /> As far as single character , first person dungeon crawls go , this is easily the best of all time .#### #### ####[([113, 114], [289], 'POS')]

Being relatively new to DSLR photography this is my first experience with Lightroom software . Previously I had used point-and-shoot cameras and made adjustments with Photoshop Elements , which I liked a lot . I resisted Lightroom because I thought PS Elements did everything I could possibly need - I was wrong. < br />< br /> Having joined a digital photography club in an attempt to learn more about my camera , I was surprised at how universally the other , more experienced members , loved and recommended Lightroom . In addition to being a superior tool for organizing photos , Lightroom also allows you to do some nice editing and seems to handle edits to my Canon RAW files better than Elements did . There is also an option to take the files I 've been working on in Lightroom and &# 34 ; Edit In &# 34 ; another program , so I can finish them off in Elements . Or , I can just use my favorite filters in Lightroom directly. < br />< br /> In addition to editing , Lightroom makes it easy to watermark your photos and publish them to the internet , including Facebook. < br />< br /> Maybe my favorite feature in Lightroom is the ability to tether the camera to the PC while I 'm doing a shoot and see the images in full size . With a full size image on the screen it 's so much easier to see if I need to make changes in lighting , position , filters , etc. < br />< br /> Learning and using Lightroom was not intuitive for me , even as someone with years of experience using Adobe 's Photoshop Elements . However , there are some fantastic free video tutorials on the Adobe website that can walk you through how to do the basic functions . For experienced Lightroom users there is also a video with detailed outlines of six new features and improvements in Lightroom 5. < br />< br /> Highly recommended to anyone who is trying to move beyond basic point-and-shoot photography and basic edits .#### #### ####[([12, 13], [188], 'POS'), ([12, 13], [249], 'POS'), ([12, 13], [276, 277], 'POS'), ([89], [188], 'POS'), ([89], [249], 'POS')]

I have been using Cook'n since version 1 , I think . I started out using Master Chef . It was very hard to use . Cook'n is amazing . It has an interface that allows you to import recipes from multiple sources . The manual input for recipes is about as easy to use as it can be . You can build your cookbook any way you want , with chapters that you set up and name . You can search many different ways including just in your cookbook or the entire internet . You can attach pictures and notes . You can even file tips with no recipe . I used to have over 100 cookbooks ; my wife was military and travelled about 75 % of the time , globally . Every country or state that she visited , she bought me a cookbook . I now have about 5 . I rely on Cook'n completely . You can purchase ( at a discount ) or use a coupon code for a free cookbook every month . The entire cookbook is download to the Cook'n database . After importing it , you can move your favorites to your personal cookbook . Cook'n is a great piece of software for active cooks . There is a menu planner and a grocery list formulator , as well . The software works on PC , Mac , phones and iPads . Very versatile .#### #### ####[([24], [207], 'POS'), ([24], [28], 'POS'), ([33], [207], 'POS'), ([33], [28], 'POS'), ([33], [242], 'POS'), ([45, 46], [52], 'POS'), ([230], [207], 'POS'), ([230], [28], 'POS'), ([230], [242], 'POS')]

The 100 % Truth about this OS is that it is a very early version of Windows XP PRO , and one that has a good deal of XP Home in it too . Recognizing this fact that it might be , I had a professional computer Expert load it for me . This program is missing all of the required main drivers to make it work properly , but which he loaded in from the Internet . This version is the very earliest of the XP programs coming directly from NT & Windows 2000 . It cost me an extra $ 110.00 to make it work which it does nicely for me now , but all I wanted to use it for is to run the old Microsoft style games that either they produced or Sierra did originally . While the gentleman also loaded a driver in to take me on the Internet in a LAN connection for DSL , I personally would NOT recommend you do it , because it is a very outdated OS system still recognizing Internet Explorer # 6 . This OS system by itself is practically worthless , but still fun if you do it the way I did , then it runs fine . Also , there is no working writing program unless you happen to have a copy of something like Windows Office 97 like I do . That should work fine . As yet I have not researched for an old style printer with a usable driver that will work IF one still exists (?).< br />< br /> I might add , that I 've already had & used an updated version of XP PRO from 2007 that is much more refined , and worked better and was from IBM instead of ' Dell ' and lasted for me until the hard drive died last year in June of 2014 . Then I began with Lubuntu ( a < br /> Linux system OS ) on a new hard drive , and now I own 2 computers using different operating systems. < br />< br /> So the end result is --- You can buy this old OS , but unless you know Exactly how to set it up for yourself , then plan on spending + $ 100.00 to get someone else to do it for you . Of course , you can always purchase a brand new copy of a more recent XP PRO for upwards of $ 300.00 and get a clean copy that ' may ' have everything . Ideally , software that trains you to read music should have a rhythm-only mode , a notes-only mode ( wait for note ) , and a rhythm-and-notes-together mode . Of the currently-available software titles for training yourself to read score , the ones I 've found to be good are Adventus Piano Suite ( which has all three of the modes I just described ) , Piano Marvel , and Etude Sight Reader . The best software I 've used for training in sight reading is the Miracle Piano Teaching System , which is now unfortunately discontinued . So , all things considered , I 'd say that Adventus Piano Suite is arguably the best currently-available score-reading software . The main window is not resizable but there are three zoom levels that help with that . The modes take a moment to get used to , the software would benefit from keyboard shortcuts and a bit of UI redesign ( it is quite old now for software ) but none of those things are serious enough to detract even a single star . And for its primary purpose which is to teach you to read music and train you to do that quickly , it has absolutely everything you 'd need and it does it well . Despite its outdated appearance this is a very solid piece of Windows programming . Which brings me to another consideration , which is that Adventus Piano Suite is Windows-only . I can see that Piano Marvel , which benefits from the broad reach that all browser-based software does , has a wider audience than Windows users . But Piano Marvel ( at time of writing ) lacks the features of Adventus Piano Suite . And being a web app , rather than native , it 's likely a little more prone to stability and performance issues . I have n't seen any perf or latency issues with Adventus Piano Suite . I have a Korg M3 with firewire connected to my PC . Also , even though the title is probably 20 years old , it works without any problem on Windows 8.1 ( you have to download the HTML Help viewer separately , but Windows will guide you through that process the first time to try to access the Help menu ) . Knowing some of the differences between Win8.1 and Win10 , I 'd be surprised if this title does not work just as well on Windows 10 , also . If you do n't want to buy it used from Amazon , go to the adventus website and buy it there .#### #### ####[([88], [283], 'POS'), ([121], [283], 'POS'), ([285], [283], 'POS'), ([311], [283], 'POS'), ([311], [312], 'POS')]
&# 34 ; Latin is a dead language < br /> As dead as it can be < br /> First it killed the Romans < br /> And now it 's killing me &# 34 ;< br />< br /> Latin , as taught , is dry and pedantic . Yet Ovid viewed it as something with which to pick up girls ; while Martial hurled vicious insults with it . Rosetta Stone introduces us to that sort of Latin . The stuff of everyday life . And I keep with it because that hideous grammar was , nevertheless , something with which they , you know , actually talked. < br />< br /> It is for this intuitive quality that I do not damn this program . Rather , I consign it to purgatory. < br />< br /> First the vocabulary is absurd . Do we really need to know what they , perhaps , might have used for &# 34 ; computer &# 34 ; or &# 34 ; telephone ,&# 34 ; or &# 34 ; airplane &# 34 ; There is some value in wordplay , but Rosetta Stone should emphasize the words found in common textbooks or flash card sets. < br />< br /> And second , it is particularly frustrating when Rosetta Stone tells me I have mispronounced one of these made up words . Really ? Yes , I know that many scholars have beliefs about how Latin was pronounced , and you may agree with them This is not the proper venue for us to debate this . Suffice it to say that Latin is a language that we do not speak but rather read . There is some value in attempting to pronounce it . You thereby use your entire brain , which enhances your comprehension . And which makes Latin more like a &# 34 ; real &# 34 ; language . But constantly to be punished for what Rosetta Stone thinks is a bad accent is absurd . OK , I have a Pompeii accent or sound like some hick from Britannia . Life is short , and I 'd rather be reading Ovid . Which is what I may do if this Rosetta Stone course does not get real .#### #### ####[([96], [95], 'NEG'), ([96], [146], 'NEG'), ([96], [219], 'NEG'), ([96], [338], 'NEG'), ([144], [6], 'NEG'), ([144], [49], 'NEG'), ([144], [95], 'NEG'), ([144], [146], 'NEG'), ([144], [219], 'NEG'), ([144], [306], 'NEG')]

I was tempted to give this three stars just because I 've learned how bad overall card game software seems to be , and this may be better than most if you 're looking for specific non-solitaire games . I bought this and SolSuite ( the download of the free trial version is available via a &# 34 ; sponsored &# 34 ; link on Amazon or you can easily find their web site ) a while ago when I accidentally deleted all the Microsoft games from my old XP laptop . If you 're looking for solitaire games , SolSuite is vastly better. < br />< br /> I bought the 2008 version of Hoyle after reading reviews here , saying it 's preferable to the later versions . It seems like very old-fashioned clunky software that 's in need of a total overhaul . It 's slow . It sometimes freaks out and does strange things on my Win 7 laptop , though it 's never actually crashed . It takes up my whole screen so I ca n't do anything else while it 's open . . . I ca n't find any way to minimize it or change the size . . . maybe there 's a way around that , but I have n't found it . The music plays the same short snippets of pieces over and over . Very annoying , so I turned it off . The settings do n't always seem to hold - for example , I kept trying to increase the the number of shuffles allowed on a game . Eventually this &# 34 ; took &# 34 ; for some unknown reason and it 's working now . But until it did , it kept announcing that the game was over and shutting it down long before I 'd intended. < br />< br /> In addition , this software , unless I 'm missing something , is n't good for learning games if you do n't already know them . SolSuite has pretty good game instructions , statistics on difficulty and so forth , and it also has a &# 34 ; hint &# 34 ; option , which I find very useful when I 'm learning a new game . I would like to find software for games other than solitaire that has aids of that type . My main reason for buying the Hoyle was to try to learn new games , but that 's not gonna happen. < br />< br /> So I would say if you already know how to play a non-solitaire card game you ca n't find elsewhere and your tolerance for a fairly primitive interface is high , this may be okay for you . But I would n't recommend it for anything else . It seems as though it was designed for DOS and never really made the leap to Windows !#### #### ####[([136], [135], 'NEG'), ([136], [236], 'NEG'), ([136], [454], 'NEG'), ([100], [236], 'NEG'), ([100], [346], 'NEG'), ([100], [454], 'NEG'), ([223], [236], 'NEG'), ([223], [454], 'NEG'), ([455], [135], 'NEG'), ([455], [236], 'NEG'), ([455], [454], 'NEG')]

It seems that a lot of the hate for Windows 8 is based around the Start Screen . Luckily , you can download programs that give you the Start Menu back . Also you can boot to the desktop and entirely bypass the Start Screen , so those issues can easily be taken care of . The fact that it 's not the default option on desktop platforms is inexcusable , but the option is there and it is easy to resolve . In fact , you never have to use the Start Screen at all . I certainly do n't anyway . If you are an advanced user there are even more tweaks to get Windows 8 the way you want it to be. < br />< br /> Yes Microsoft made some mistakes with Windows 8 , but it is hardly unusable . I am not a fan of the UI , as I preferred the classic look which is unfortunately gone and no replacement is available . Some of the behavior of Windows 8 is inconsistent as well . However it 's definitely faster than Windows 7 . I 've had no crashes or issues so far either . Granted I only had maybe one crash on Windows 7 in over three years of use so it 's been comparable in terms of stability so far . I like Windows 8 a lot more than I thought I would . It just needed time to mature and for MS to realize that this is NOT what people wanted , initially anyway , from a desktop OS . Hopefully Windows 10 will resolve all the issues users had with Windows 8 .#### #### ####[([9, 10], [79], 'POS'), ([9, 10], [143], 'POS'), ([15, 16], [7], 'POS'), ([15, 16], [143], 'POS')]

SmartDraw CI is a diagramming software for Windows which ships with lots of templates , e. g. for floor plans , flowcharts , and calendars . My first impression of the trial version was very positive because the user interface looks modern and I hoped that SmartDraw would be easy to use . But I soon ran into problems . * The user interface might appear modern , but most dialogue boxes look like a reincarnation of ancient Windows 98 . * You want to export to PDF ? SmartDraw will install a printer driver to accomplish this . * Exporting to Microsoft Word 2010 results in a document containing a picture which means that you cannot edit it besides adjusting contrast , brightness etc . To change the labels or something else , you have to edit the SmartDraw document and export it again . * At your first Excel import ( e. g. to obtain data for a bar chart ) , an ActiveX component is installed . * According to the current ( 2015 ) User Guide , you need Visio to import Visio documents . My trial version behaved differently . SmartDraw CI apparently sends your Visio document to a Web server , converts it , and sends it back to you . Or it is supposed to do this , for the trial version could not connect to the server . * You cannot use SVG with SmartDraw . * Although there is a huge amount of templates , there is no support for bubble charts . * Besides some pre-sets , I could not find any options for 3d bar charts . ( The Perspective Export mentioned in the User Guide is something different and was not available either . ) *** For my purposes , SmartDraw CI offers to few features for too much money . Microsoft Office 2010 is cheaper and supports PDF , bubble charts and 3d bar charts . If you are looking for an affordable alternative , try Edraw Max 7.9 . It supports SVG , exports to PDF and Microsoft Office ( resulting in a drawing which you can edit within Word ) , is compatible with Visio and has a modern user interface featuring ribbons.has a modern user interface featuring ribbons .#### #### ####[([63], [41], 'NEU'), ([63], [66], 'NEU'), ([63], [379], 'NEU'), ([38, 39], [41], 'NEU'), ([38, 39], [66], 'NEU'), ([38, 39], [379], 'NEU'), ([46], [49], 'NEU'), ([46], [58], 'NEU'), ([46], [238], 'NEU'), ([46], [367], 'NEU'), ([62, 63], [41], 'NEU'), ([62, 63], [66], 'NEU'), ([62, 63], [379], 'NEU'), ([123], [49], 'NEU'), ([123], [58], 'NEU'), ([123], [367], 'NEU'), ([165, 166], [292, 293], 'NEU'), ([165, 166], [367], 'NEU'), ([121], [49], 'NEU'), ([121], [58], 'NEU'), ([121], [238], 'NEU'), ([121], [367], 'NEU')]

I have been a fan of WordPerfect since the old DOS based WP5.1 . I believe it is a far superior product to Word . The ability to format is vastly superior , primarily because of the reveal,codes feature , , which allows you to see exactly what formatting has been applied at precise spots in the document . The ability to type a document was also superior , as virtually all commands could be entered from the keyboard , without the need to slow down typing to wrestle with the mouse , drop down menus , etc. < br />< br /> WordPerfect fell out of favor as the world moved to Windows and graphics interfaces . The Microsoft marketing juggernaut convinced everyone to switch to Word , which over the years became more and more bloated with features which no one uses , but which require three or four clicks to accomplish simple things like changing paragraph layouts. < br />< br /> In recent years , WordPerfect has fought back , adding graphics interfaces,while retaining the simple interface which I loved . X7 continues this tradition . Fully compatible with Word ( so you can import all your friends screwed up Word documents , and return them in Word readable format ) , it still,retains the reveal codes and other features I love . Nice step up from the X5 I had been using , but more relevantly , light years ahead of any version of Word .#### #### ####[([139], [137], 'POS'), ([180], [20], 'POS'), ([180], [31], 'POS'), ([180], [179], 'POS'), ([223], [67], 'POS')]

When I was a kid , I obsessively played the shareware version of this game , which only included the first table ( Super Android ) . I 've always wondered what the other tables were like -- and now I know !< br />< br /> I may be biased because of nostalgia , but I think Super Android is the best table of the bunch : it 's got lots of ramps and targets , good graphics , a decent amount of challenge , and on-screen instructions to guide you through each of the objectives . As for the non-shareware tables , the gameplay is pretty good , but not quite as compelling. < br />< br /> There is a * lot * of variation between tables , with things like flipper sizes , table features , and score readouts varying from table to table . Each one really feels like a different computer game ! As a result , some of the tables have grown on me ( I * really * like Excalibur at the moment ; Deep and Sea is good , as well as Crash and Burn ) , but some of the others have n't . It 's hard to describe , but Enigma , Space Journey , and Toy Factory feel &# 34 ; cheap &# 34 ; or &# 34 ; flimsy &# 34 ; , like I 'm playing a free online game. < br />< br /> Also of note : I got the jewel case with informational booklet . The &# 34 ; expert tips &# 34 ; are n't spectacular , and the writing has a couple of typos ... so do n't feel bad if you do n't have the booklet . However , the booklet did give me a greater appreciation of what Epic Pinball tried to be : a collection of * various styles * of pinball tables of different , inspired by both old and modern tables in real life . On that front , I think Epic did fairly well. < br />< br /> Overall , I 'm glad that I finally bought the full version , even though it was n't as awesome as I expected . If you 're on the fence , I recommend trying out the shareware version , which you can still get from DOS shareware sites . It runs great in DOSBox !#### #### ####[([78], [77], 'POS'), ([105], [108], 'POS'), ([105], [405], 'POS'), ([137, 138], [282], 'POS'), ([217, 218], [108], 'POS'), ([217, 218], [405], 'POS'), ([277], [282], 'POS')]

It boasts of its unique sight-singing and melody imitation feature . There is even a Youtube Video of Hans Jakobsen using the sight-singing feature . A little bit about my life . In my music program at York University , they had the first year students sight-singing and I was terrible at it , but wanting to improve . After the winter semester , I bought this program , thinking it will help me with my problems with singing pitches . However , due to technical difficulties with I do n't know the microphone , the configuration , or basically my inexperience with singing pitches . It just defeats the purpose of why I bought this program. < br />< br /> The program always marks my answers wrong in the sight-singing and melody imitation feature . Even simple do re mi melodies , even though I am singing the correct pitch , it would be marked as wrong . There was one time I spend 28 attempts singing literally a do re mi melody and it was marked as wrong . Makes me look stupid , makes me feel bad about myself . The company declared that EarMaster is a patient , non-judgmental teacher . More like having Simon Cowell judging my &# 34 ; awfully dreadful &# 34 ; singing voice. < br />< br /> The pros of this program are the Melodic Dictation and Interval Singing Feature . I am progressing with these features . My only problem with Interval Singing is that it records unnecessary pitches that I did n't sing . I was able to solve that using the eraser in the toolbox . Or else this program would be a load of Bull-crap. < br />< br /> For the sight-singing , I solved that problem by joining Mark O'Leary's sight singing school online . I am progressing much faster in sight singing than Ear Master. < br />< br /> Overall , I stopped using EarMaster years ago , because it focuses on interval training . The exercises are artificial and not found in real music . Interval Training is a heresy taught in many music schools . I discovered that Keycenter Tonality Internalisation by singing the pitches and listening is the correct method to train your ear. < br />< br /> EarMaster and Auralia are , both expensive and a waste of money . Not recommended.ter Tonality Internalisation by singing the pitches and listening is the correct method to train your ear . EarMaster and Auralia are , both expensive and a waste of money .
